- Ensure a minimum distance of 1 meter (Place information by means of displays, signs, stands, floor markings or other aids in the entrance areas and at the reception of the accommodation company and etc).
- Design the catering area (Observe guidelines for catering establishments for general information)
- Adapt additional offers (fitness areas and wellness areas, according to their requirements)
- Place recommendations for behavior that are clearly visible to the guest
Starting on August 1, night bars and discos in Austria can again open with up to 60% of capacity. Closing time will be 4:00 in the morning.

In Austria, A new government plan to mandate restaurants and bars to collect the names, addresses and contact information of all their guests has drawn the ire of the gastronomy sector. Announced on August 27.

The Austrian ski school union has released new corona guidelines for the upcoming winter season.
-Ski and snowboard instructors must be tested for the coronavirus on a regular basis. The union has requested for testing costs to be paid for by the Ministry of Agriculture, Regions, and Tourism.
-Groups are capped at ten individuals, including the instructor.
-All students must register their contact information.
-In case an individual shows corona symptoms, he or she must be separated from the group.
-Masks are required whenever the minimum distance cannot be kept.
From March 10, 2020, Austria bans gatherings of more than 500 people outdoors and more than 100 people in confined spaces.
In Austria, for Easter holidays, the governement announced that meetings are only allowed in a closed room if "no more than five people who do not live in the same household participate"

In Austria, from September 14, Events with no fixed seating will be limited to 50 attendants indoors and 100 attendants outdoors. Bigger events with spaced seating will be limited to 1,500 people inside and 3,000 people outside.
In Austria from September 21, In restaurants, a maximum of 10 people can sit on one table. Masks have to be worn everywhere when not sitting. Consuming drinks and food is only allowed when seated.

From March 12, 2020, Austria issues the recommendation to stop visits to elderly homes and hospitals. Although it is no ban, Austrians are strongly advised to stay away. Exceptions are in place for children as well as for palliative care.

In Austria from March 16, the government implemented new rules that stated that, when entering public places (outdoors, indoors: supermarkets, public transportetc.)and at work, a distance of at least one meter from other persons must be maintained
In Austria from April 14, 2020, Obligation to wear a mouth-nose protection mask also in public transport and when usng Carpooling with people who do not live in the same household,

Austria reintroduces mandatory mask-wearing in supermarkets, banks and post offices. It also includes an obligation to wear masks when visiting a care home or hospital. Masks continue to be obligatory on public transport and in pharmacies.

In Austria, starting September 1, Austrian Airlines is limiting the exceptions to the mask requirement.
Previously, passengers with a medical letter were exempt from wearing a mask when flying. Now, the medical letter must be written on an AUA-Formblatt, and passengers must provide a negative corona test result.
Since May, passengers have been required to wear masks upon entering the respective terminal until they arrive at their destination.
Austrian Health Ministry issued a novelization of the Covid act which now foresees mandatory mask wearing in all shops, stores and other indoor rooms starting from September 14.
In Austria from September 21, masks also have to be worn outside on markets and trade fairs

Belgium is taking anti-disinformation measures from 21st of April. UNESCO Brussels, the European Union and Twitter join forces to launch a European social media campaign to address misinformation on Covid-19 and #ThinkBeforeSharing.

Belgium announced on March 12 that schools will be suspended on the night of the 13th. There will be exceptions for children of healthcare, transport, and other essential workers. Creches (nurseries) will also be open. Schools will reopen gradually as of June 2.

May 28th: Belgium allows preschools and primary schools to reopen. However, secondary schools will not be reopened nationwide. Instead, the Communities decide whether or not to reopen secondary schools. They may only decide to reopen recondary schools for a couple of days.
The authorities in Belgium have decided to introduce a COVID-19 curfew in the country from October 19. The measures are set to last for one month, but the situation will be evaluated after two weeks.

In Belgium as of June 15th, Belgium will open its borders for travel to and from the European Union, including the United Kingdom and the four other Schengen countries (Switzerland, Liechtenstein, Iceland and Norway). However, it is up to each country to decide whether to open its borders. To know the situation in the country of destination, it is therefore advisable to consult the website of the FPS Foreign Affairs. The conditions for travel outside of Europe have yet to be defined in light of the evolution of discussions at European level.
March 30th: Belgian experts and scientists launch real-time online tracking platform that charts the evolution of the new coronavirus

May 4th: Belgium will introduce a new contact tracing strategy, from 11 May onward. The strategy looks as follows:

When a patient is tested, the doctor performing the test will ask the patient to record their contacts over the last few days.

From the middle of this week, patients infected with Covid-19 will be contacted by a call centre to ask who they have been in close contact with over the past few days. The form they filled out may be helpful during this call. People who have recently been in close contact with an infected person will also be called by the call centre. Their state of health will be assessed and, on that basis, they will be asked to take the necessary measures.

The infected patients " general practitioner will already ask them whether they have been in close contact with certain people, such as people living in the same household. In this case, the general practitioner can issue a quarantine certificate for these people, even if the individuals concerned do not (yet) show symptoms and are fit for work. Individuals who have been issued with such a quarantine certificate must comply with the isolation measures. They can, however, work from home.

Under certain, strictly defined conditions this quarantine certificate may also be issued by the call centre under the responsibility of a hygiene inspector.
In Belgium, as of June 8th it will be possible to travel within Belgium for trips lasting one or more days.
Belgium announced that a national lockdown will go into effect on March 18th until April 5.

April 15th: Previously, no visitors were in allowed in Belgian nursing homes. From May 3rd onward, however, residents of residential facilities  " i.e. rest and care homes or centres for people with disabilities  " will be allowed to be visited by a pre-designated person. 
The condition is that the person in question has not shown any symptoms of the disease in the past two weeks. It must always be the same person. The residential facilities will be able to organise these visits themselves. These rules will also apply to people who live in isolation and are unable to move around.

It is unclear when this policy is slated to end.

Wednesday 29 April: Belgium "s lockdown measures will be relaxed slightly from 4 May. In practice, this means that the companies will be allowed to open their doors on 4 May. However, telework remains the norm wherever possible.
Cycling or going for a walk as a group of three will also be allowed.
Some sports played in pairs and in the open air, such as kayaking and tennis, will be allowed again, also without physical contact. Locker rooms and cafeterias will remain closed.

On Wednesday 6 May the new phase of the lockdown phase-out strategy, phase 1b, which will start on 11 May was announced.
Every family may receive a maximum of four people - always the same - at home. Shops will reopen. To avoid overcrowding, people will have to do their shopping alone. It is also recommend that people frequent shops that are located in a city or town near your home or workplace. Day trips and tourist activities are still not allowed.
Belgium created a new police task force responsible for enforcing lockdown in a unified manner towards civilians and businesses
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: On February 2nd, 9 Belgian nationals returned from Wuhan. All nationals returning are required to quarantine for 14 days until February 16th at Neder-over-Heembeek military hospital

Belgium: Since the beginning of May, all people with symptoms and close contacts of COVID-positive people are tested. The following isolation and quarantine rules apply:
 " For symptomatic people: If results are positive, people have to isolate at home for at least 7 additional days after receiving their test results. If they have no symptoms at day 7, isolation can be stopped.
 " For asymptomatic close contacts: Up to October 1st, if the test result was negative, close contacts must remain in quarantine for 14 days after the last risk contact.

May 6th: Previously, all non-essential businesses in Belgium had to close their doors. Since May 11th, all regular stores can open again (at earlier stages, fabric stores, garden centres and DIY stores were allowed to open already).

Yet, many non-essential businesses must remain closed still. These include:
- Markets (only individual market stalls (food and non-food) will be allowed by the local authorities and at the usual locations)
- Cafes, bars, restaurants and festivity halls
- Recreational, cultural and tourist sites 
- Hairdressers, beautycians and other businesses that require physical contact

Belgium is starting Phase 4 as of July 1st. The public capacity for one-off events has expanded to a 200 person indoor capacity and 400 person outdoor capacity based on permits given out by local authoriteis

12th of March: Belgium encourages citizens to work from home.
The instructions are as follows:
Keep working, but work from home as much as possible. Postpone meetings or organise them online. When at work, keep a distance from each other and follow the hygiene prescriptions. If possible, change working hours so that less people are at work at the same time.

In Belgium as of June 8th 2020, sporting events (organized and supervised by a person in charge) are limited to 20 people in June and 50 people in July, subject to safety distances.

From 8 June, non-contact sports activities can be resumed, both indoor and outdoor, amateur or professional, league and training. Gyms and fitness rooms may also be reopened, subject to protocol.

However:

    Contact sports (e.g. judo, boxing, football, etc.) should always be limited to  "contactless " training;
    As far as sports facilities are concerned, the protocols will also have to be followed. Changing rooms and showers will still not be accessible;
    Swimming pools, saunas and wellness centres have to remain closed at this stage.

As far as sports are concerned, everything will be allowed again from 1 July, provided that the protocols are respected.

In both the cultural and sports industries, from 1 July, a seated audience of up to 200 people - regardless of the size of the venue - will be allowed, subject to safety distances and always in strict compliance with protocols.

In Belgium as of June 8th, leisure and free-time activities will be permitted.

Cultural and leisure activities have to be organised in such a way as to avoid large gatherings. Wearing a mask is recommended at all times. Gatherings (e.g. village fairs, village festivals, etc.) are prohibited until 1 August and may then be resumed gradually. Large-scale mass events, on the other hand, will remain prohibited until 31 August, as previously announced.

In Belgium from 8 June, cultural activities may resume without an audience present.  Performances with an audience - including cinemas - can be resumed from 1 July, but only subject to specific rules regarding crowd management, such as respecting the safety distance in the audience and a maximum of 200 attendees.

Activities should be organised in such a way as to avoid gatherings of too many people, e.g. outside the venue.  When people take part in cultural and leisure activities, wearing a mask is recommended at all times.  Cultural events would be limited to 20 people in June and 50 people in July, subject to safety restritions.

The Pernambuco Department of Health and the Ministry of Health provide through their official channels accurate and secure information about the disease. Coronavirus information can also be obtained by calling 136 (Dial Health). It is still valid to warn that the spread of false news, which can harm public health, is subject to legal sanctions.
Brazil declares a state of emergency.
On March 18, 2020, Brazil's Ministry of Health advised "from January 28th that travel to China should be made in cases of extreme need."
"Brazil will partially close its border with Venezuela starting on Wednesday (18th March 2020) to slow the spread of the new coronavirus, while allowing trucks with merchandise to continue crossing"
On March 22, 2020, the Brazilian government announced that from that date on "it is restricted, for a period of thirty days, the entry into the country, by land, of foreigners from Uruguay."

Brazil is "prohibiting entry to people from European and many Pacific Asian countries...they apply to people coming from the European Union, Britain, Iceland, Norway and Switzerland, as well as China, Japan, South Korea, Australia and Malaysia who are not Brazilian residents or do not have valid work or family reasons to travel"

On March 19, 2020, the government of Brazil announced that, from March 23 on, "foreigners from the following countries are restricted for thirty days from entering the country by air: China; Members of the European Union; Iceland, Norway, Switzerland, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland; Australia; Japan; Malaysia; and Korea."

On March 23, 2020, the government of Brazil announced that "foreigners from the following countries are restricted for thirty days from entering the country by air: China, Countries Members of the European Union, Iran, Iceland, Norway, Switzerland, United Kingdom, Northern Ireland, Australia, Japan, Malaysia, and Korea."

On March 26, 2020, the Brazilian government announced that from that date on "it is restricted, for a period of thirty days, the landing of foreigners in a port or point in the Brazilian territory, by waterway, regardless of their nationality."
On March 27, 2020, the government of Brazil announced that, from March 30 on, "foreigners are restricted from entering the country by air for 30 days, regardless of their nationality."

On April 29, 2020, the Brazilian government announced that from that date on, "it is restricted, for a period of thirty days, the entry into the country, by road or other land means, of foreigners of any nationality."

Brazil "s Ministry of Health announced on Friday, February 21, that it has expanded quarantine measures for travelers arriving from several Asian countries showing symptoms of coronavirus (COVID-19). Travelers arriving from China, Japan, South Korea, North Korea, Singapore, Vietnam, Thailand, and Cambodia showing signs of COVID-19 will be placed under quarantine until they are confirmed to be free of the virus.

Change in workflow of how hospitals process potential Corona virus cases. Becomes more decentralised so each medical facility can process cases quicker. Also training more of testing labs so they have the ability to process the corona test - originally just 1 lab had the capability, 3 more are being trained.
30,000 new diagnostic kits available to all regions

On Mar., the Ministry of Health (MS) starts the distribution of tests (Berlin protocols) for the diagnosis of the new coronavirus to 13 Brazilian states, plus the Federal District. In the Northeast, the tests will be for Bahia, Cear ", Sergipe, and Pernambuco. With the arrival of the kits, the MS will train state technicians on site.
Call for 5000 doctors. 5000 vacancies for doctors opened across the Country. Temporary roles for 1 year.

On March 16, the Official Diary of the Union published that the Federal Government will transfer R$19,3mi to Pernambuco. Also, The Ministry of Health also announced the release of 540 complete kits for the assembly of ICU beds for severe cases of coronavirus, which should indicate the implementation of about 90 beds in Pernambuco

On March, 18, 2020, the National Health Surveillance Agency (Anvisa) of Brazil announced that "Surgical masks and other PPE, according to each situation described above, should be provided by the airline. Airlines should ensure that their employees have adequate training on how to use them to avoid increased risks."
Brazil. 27th March 2020. Construction of the Fiocruz Hospital Center for the Covid-19 Pandemic.
Brazil. 30th March 2020. Purchase and distribution of 40 million items of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
Brazil. 4th April 2020. Brazilian Federal Government purchased 15 thousand respirators.
Brazil. April 8th 2020. Federal Government starts construction of the first field hospital in  "guas Lindas
Brazil 8th April 2020. Ministry of Healthy buys 240 million masks.
Brazil 15th April 2020. 3,391 more doctors will be able to reinforce coronavirus care at health centers
Brazil. April 16th 2020. Ministry of Health enables 92 more beds to fight against coronavirus. Guaranteed federal resources for critical cases.
Brazil, April 20th 2020. Ministry of Health buys 3300 respirators from manufacturers in Brazil

Brazil May 2nd 2020. A reinforcement of 267 health professionals, hired by the Ministry of Health, to act in the fight against Covid-19. There are 37 doctors, 118 nurses, 57 nursing technicians, 26 physiotherapists, 12 pharmacists and 17 biomedical doctors.
Brazil. 20 May 2020. Ministry of Health Publishes guidenlines for the use of drug treatments for people with COVID-19 symptoms. Including the use of hydroxychloroquine
Brazil. 2 June 2020. More than 2600 ventilators delivered by the Ministry of Health to various States across the Country

Brazil. 12 June 2020. The strategic action Brasil Conta Comigo has already received 978 thousand registrations of health professionals interested in acting on the front line in the fight against Covid-19 across the country. Of these, 416, among doctors, nurses, nursing technicians, physiotherapists, pharmacists and biomedicals, were directly hired by the Federal Government and are reinforcing the provision of health services.

Brazil. 16 June 2020. The Ministry of Health published an ordinance that defines the technical criteria for the implantation of Temporary Health Units for hospital assistance or the exclusive care of patients with Covid-19.

Brazil. 18 June 2020. The Ministry of Health has already distributed 4,435 pieces of equipment to all states and the Federal District. Deliveries reinforce hospital assistance for municipalities to deal with the pandemic

Brazil. 09 June 2020. So far, 115.2 million items of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) has been distributed by the Ministry of Health. Normally this is the responsibility of States, but given the demand, Federal level has taken greater responsibility in purchasing and distributing.
Coronavirus testing in hospitalized patients with severe respiratory conditions, regardless of travel abroad
Brazil. 29 May 2020. 451% increase in testing capacity. Average of 7624 tests conducted daily in May
On March, 18, 2020, the National Health Surveillance Agency (Anvisa) of Brazil announced a series of cleaning/sanitation methods and techniques that should be adopted by airline staff.

On March, 18, 2020, the National Health Surveillance Agency (Anvisa) of Brazil announced that "professionals responsible for handling accompanied luggage [of an individual suspected of COVID-19 infection] should use procedure gloves and surgical masks, immediately followed by sanitizing hands."

On March 18, 2020, the National Health Surveillance Agency (Anvisa) of Brazil declared that "For the protection of the health of the population and professionals working at ports, airports, borders and related means of transportation, considering the real possibility of contact with travelers compatible with the case definition for COVID 19, it is essential to adopt precautionary measures such as frequent hand hygiene and the correct use of personal protective equipment (PPE) by front line workers at ports, airports and borders."

Brazil passed a decree that set up a "Inter-ministerial Executive Group on Public Health Emergency of National and International Importance". Group responsible for monitoring, preparing and dealing with any national or international health emergencies.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: On April 4th, 2020, the Acute Respiratory Syndromes Surveillance System of Brazil was given the additional responsibilities of guiding the National Health Surveillance System and the Health Care Services Network in studying COVID-19 and establishing measures to improve the impacts of the pandemic.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: Brazil. 12 June 2020. Ministry of Health launched new platform to monitor and analyse the cases and deaths of Coronavirus, nationally, regionally and by municipality. Data is open and accessible to anybody.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: Brazil. 26 June 2020. The Ministry of Health's management now has the reinforcement of the Rationale Task Force, which will support measures to combat Covid-19. According to the norm, the Force will have the mission of coordinating all the processes of acquisition and distribution of equipment, supplies and medicines agreed by the portfolio. The document also contemplates its competencies, composition and planned actions, such as maintaining or strengthening hospital services, in addition to enabling beds in Intensive Care Units (ICUs) to face the pandemic.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: On March 22nd, Brazil creates a Provisional Measure which allows employers to implement different labor actions during Coronavirus, such as telework, individual vacations anticipation, collective vacation, holiday anticipation, hour bank. suspension on administrative requirements on labor security and health, FGTS withdraw and contract suspension for a qualification course .
Brazil. 26th March 2020. Ministry of Health published guidance on management of bodies in the context of the corona virus, and recommended funeral and burial procedure.

On May 13, 2020, the Brazilian government announced that "Public agents can only be held responsible in the civil and administrative spheres if they act or omit with intent or gross error for the practice of acts directly or indirectly related to the measures of I - coping with the public health emergency resulting from the covid-19 pandemic; and II - combating the economic and social effects resulting from the covid-19 pandemic."
Brazil 29 January 2020 Ministry of Health begins daily briefings about the coronavirus situation in Brazil, urging caution

Friday (28. Feb), Brazil Ministry of Health launched the coronavirus prevention advertising campaign, on open TV, radio and the internet. Guide the population to prevent the disease by adopting hygiene habits, such as washing hands with soap and water several times a day, making use of 70% gel alcohol and not sharing personal items.
Brazil 13 March 2020 Ministry of Health recommends all bodies of the public administration to run information campaigns to warn about the risks of coronavirus
Brazil 13 March 2020 Digital campaign from Ministry of Health to prevent from Coronavirus
Brazil. 26th March 2020. Ministry of Health launches Whatsapp channel that provides information about COVID-19

Brazil. March 31st 2020. New app allows the Ministry of Health to send messages and alerts to cell phones and tablets, even with the app closed or not being used at that time. The tool allows the Health Surveillance Secretariat, responsible for the epidemiological surveillance of the coronavirus pandemic in Brazil, to make communications available to users in general or specific public segments.

Brazil established a law that outlined measures that can be adopted to deal with the outbreak. Includes Quarantine and Isolation measures targeted at contaminated persons or persons suspected of contamination

Brazil "s Ministry of Health announced on Friday, February 21, that it has expanded quarantine measures for travelers arriving from several Asian countries showing symptoms of coronavirus (COVID-19). Travelers arriving from China, Japan, South Korea, North Korea, Singapore, Vietnam, Thailand, and Cambodia showing signs of COVID-19 will be placed under quarantine until they are confirmed to be free of the virus.

On 13th March 2020 the Brazilian Ministry of Health recommended that all International travellers arriving in Brazil should isolate for 7 days, even those without symptoms. Those with symptoms, or those who have been in contact with somebody who is infected, advised to isolate for 14 days.
President of Brazil signed a decree (21. March 2020) that defined what is considered "essential services" to meet the needs of the population

Brazil. 18 June 2020. Federal government orders a 1m social distance and compulsory mask wearing to be maintained at all times in public and social spaces, including on public transport. In addition, guidance on regularly hygiene procedure for public transport operators.

Canada--Health Canada released a statement March 20 that disproved reports that Ibuprofen worsens COVID-19 symptoms. "There is no scientific evidence that establishes a link between ibuprofen, or other non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), and the worsening of COVID-19 symptoms"

Canada, Health Canada released a statement April 25 warning against the use of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine to treat COVID-19. This statement was released in reaction to claims that the drugs can help treat COVID-19.

The Prime Minister of Canada announced that Canada will bar foreign nationals from all countries except the United States from entering Canada as of March 16th. The measure would not apply in designated exceptional circumstances, including to air crews, travellers arriving in Canada in transit to a third country, Canadian permanent residents, diplomats, or immediate family members of Canadian citizens.

In Canada, the PM announced on March 16th the redirection of international passenger flight arrivals to four airports: Toronto Pearson International Airport, Vancouver International Airport, Montr "al-Trudeau International Airport, and Calgary International Airport.

Canada, April 17 "Today, the Minister of Transport, the Honourable Marc Garneau, announced new measures requiring all air passengers to have a non-medical mask or face covering to cover their mouth and nose during travel. These measures come into effect at noon EDT on April 20, 2020. When travelling by air, travellers will be asked to cover their mouth and nose: at Canadian airport screening checkpoints, where the screeners cannot always keep two metres of separation between themselves and the traveller; when they cannot physically distance from others, or as directed by the airline employees; and when directed to do so by a public health order or public health official."

The Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) is temporarily reducing service hours at the Crystal City, Manitoba port of entry. The previous hours of service were from 9 am to 7 pm, seven days a week. The new CBSA temporary hours of service are from 9 am to 5 pm, seven days a week starting on July 23, 2020 at 11:59 pm EDT.

Canada, beginning July 23 there will be reduced service hours at 3 ports of entry until further notice. The reduced hours will effect the ports in Crystal City (Manitoba) and Clarenceville and Stanstead (Qu "bec).

Canada announced that as of July 31, there will be new restrictions for transiting through Canada to go to/from Alaska from/to the contiguous United States. In transit travelers "must enter Canada at one of the five identified CBSA ports of entry (POE) 1. Abbotsford-Huntingdon (British Columbia) 2. Coutts (Alberta) 3. Kingsgate (British Columbia) 4. North Portal (Saskatchewan) 5. Osoyoos (British Columbia), will be allowed a reasonable period of stay to carry out the transit, will be limited to travel within Canada using the most direct route from the POE to the intended POE of exit, while avoiding all national parks, leisure sites and tourism activities, will be required, before entering the U.S., to report to the nearest CBSA POE to confirm their exit from Canada," and they must also display a hangtag from their rearview mirror indicating that they are "in-transit."
On January 22, 2020, Canada implements screening requirements related to COVID-19 for travellers returning from China to major airports in Montr "al, Toronto and Vancouver.

Canada--Public Health Agency of Canada and the Canada Border Services Agency announce April 30 that they launched the ArriveCan app. The app allows " travelers returning to Canada to input their 14-day isolation or quarantine information quickly, easily and securely upon arrival."

Candian government is mandating temperature screening for air passengers through a phased approach, first for those travelling to Canada, then for those travelling from Canada, and finally for those travelling within Canada. From the 12th of June

A passenger who has a fever will not be permitted to board their flight.

Employees in the secured areas of airports will also be required to have their temperature checked.

Canada--Transport Canada announced September 11 that in conjunction with the Public Health Agency of Canada and the county's major airlines, passengers will be asked to provide personal contact information when checking in for flights in order to be contacted if there is a possible exposure with an individual with COVID-19.
Canada, NB--As of September 18, residents in the province can begin to use the COVID Alert app "which alerts users if they have been exposed to someone who tested positive for the virus."

In Canada the Prime Minister announced on March 11th:

Help for Canadians to make informed decisions and take action to protect their health and their communities by providing $50 million to support the Public Health Agency of Canada "s COVID-19 communications and public education efforts.

Further support public health preparedness by providing $500 million to provinces and territories for critical health care system needs and to support mitigation efforts as needed. This could include help to support with access to testing, acquisition of equipment, and to enhance surveillance and monitoring. Financial considerations should not and will not be an obstacle to hospitals and health systems making the necessary preparations.

Support federal public health measures such as enhanced surveillance, increased testing at the National Microbiology Laboratory, and ongoing support for preparedness in First Nations and Inuit communities, by providing $100 million. This is in addition to an initial $50 million that was provided to support the immediate public health response.

Enhance Canada "s capacity in research and development, including research on medical countermeasures, including antivirals, vaccine development and support for clinical trials, by providing $275 million in additional funding building on top of the recent $27 million announcement to fund coronavirus research in Canada.

In Canada, as of March 18th, Health Canada is facilitating access to products (hand sanitizers, disinfectants, and personal protective equipment) that may not fully meet current regulatory requirements, as an interim measure.
In Canada, Health Canada expedites access to COVID-19 diagnostic laboratory test kits and other medical devices on March 18th.
Canada, the House of Commons passed a bill March 31 to prevent drug shortages in the country due to COVID-19.

Canada, March 31 "The Government of Canada is investing $2 billion to support diagnostic testing and to purchase ventilators and protective personal equipment, including for bulk purchases with provinces and territories. Personal protective equipment includes things like more masks and face shields, gowns, and hand sanitizer."

Canada--Health Canada announced the approval of new rapid test kits April 13. The kits are "expected to alleviate the pressure on public health laboratories and help circumvent testing kit shortages."

Canada, a new website was announced April 17 by a physician at the McGill University Health Centre that connects Canadians interested in participating in clinical trials with the research teams leading them. "The website allows people to look through all of the active clinical trials related to COVID-19 that are approved by Health Canada and to register if they wish to volunteer."
Canada, the Canadian Armed Forces will begin to be deployed to Qu "bec April 18 to  provide assistance in long-term care facilities across the country as provinces request.

Gov of Canada is funding for protective gear and care centers. annouced on July 17th. 
 
The amount is 18.4 billion CA dollars.

Canada announce July 27 that the Government of Canada will provide "$7.5 billion towards personal protective equipment." Part of this funding will also go towards the "availability of testing components like reagents, swabs, point-of-care kits, and promote innovation in developing new testing components and equipment."

Canada is allowing "eligible essential service business or organizations may apply to receive personal protective equipment (PPE), non-medical masks and disinfection products to address urgent, short-term (45 days) needs," beginning August 3, 2020.

Canada, the Government of Canada has announced an agreement with "pharmaceutical firms Pfizer and Moderna to secure millions of doses," of the vaccine the two companies are developing. The doses are not going to be available for deliver until 2021 after they are approved by Health Canada and the COVID-19 Vaccine Task Force.

Canada, An announcement was made August 21 that "The Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, and the Premier of Ontario, Doug Ford, today announced an agreement between the Government of Canada, the Government of Ontario and 3M Canada on a joint investment to expand a manufacturing facility for N95 respirators." "The facility will produce 25 million N95 respirators for the Government of Canada and 25 million for the Government of Ontario per year over five years. This will provide 50 million N95 respirators annually to help health care workers, first responders and other essential workers with the equipment they need to continue their vital work." In this announcement, it was said the first deliveries would be made in early 2021.

The federal government of Canada announced August 31 that PM Trudeau has come to agreements "with Johnson & Johnson and Novavax to procure millions of doses of experimental COVID-19 vaccines," along with agreements made with Pfizer and Moderna

Canada, as of September 22, "the Government of Canada has signed agreements with Sanofi and GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) to secure up to 72 million doses of their COVID-19 adjuvanted recombinant protein-based vaccine candidate."

Canada--The Ministry of Public Services and Procurement announced September 29, that they have made an agreement with "Abbott Rapid Diagnostics ULC to purchase up to 7.9 million ID NOW rapid point-of-care tests, pending Health Canada authorization of the tests," and "up to 3,800 analyzers."

Canada announced July 27 that "The Government of Canada will provide $4.28 billion to further expand testing and contact tracing capacity, and the associated data management and information sharing systems. This funding will ensure a national capacity to conduct 200,000 tests per day to help manage COVID-19 outbreaks over the coming year."
In Canada, on January 15, 2020, the Public Health Agency of Canada activates the Emergency Operation Centre to support Canada's response to COVID-19
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: In Canada, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau convenes the Incident Response Group for an update on the coronavirus situation on February 2nd, including next steps to assist Canadians who have requested help in departing from Wuhan, China, health measures, and travel advisories.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: he Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, announced on March 4th the creation of a new Cabinet committee on COVID-19.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: Canada, The Government of Canada is establishing "the Essential Services Contingency Reserve, to which essential service organizations can apply for temporary, urgent access to personal protective equipment (PPE) and other critical supplies."
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: Canada, a new task force was announce August 5. "The COVID-19 Vaccine Task Force draws on the expertise of its vaccine and immunology experts, and industry leaders with proven experience in developing and commercializing vaccines, to provide advice to the Government of Canada on COVID-19 vaccines." The task force will be in place for at least 12 months (August 5, 2021) with a subject to extension.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: In Canada, special immigration measures, which were first put in place on February 7, 2020, for applicants in China, provide flexibility to clients who, due to circumstances beyond their control, are unable to comply with our requirements.

Canada, the Department of Finance announced March 25 the establishment of the Canada Emergency Response Benefit (CERB). "This taxable benefit would provide $2,000 a month for up to four months for workers who lose their income as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic." The CERB is to be paid every four weeks and be available from March 15, 2020 until October 3, 2020.

Canada--March 18 the PM announced new economic measures to help "stabilize the economy and help Canadians affected by the impacts of this challenging period." The "$82 billion in support represents more than 3 per cent of Canada "s GDP. This wide-ranging support will help ensure Canadians can pay for rent and groceries, and help businesses continue to pay their employees and their bills during this time of uncertainty."

Canada--On April 5, the Canadian Food Inspection Agency recommended that "anyone with COVID-19 symptoms or those who are self-isolating due to contact with a COVID-19 case should follow similar recommendations around pets and livestock as they would around people."

Canada, the federal government announced April 13 $50 million "for farmers, fish harvesters and employers in food production and processing who need to institute a two-week isolation period for temporary foreign workers."

Canada, PM Trudeau announced September 16 the Safe Restart Agreement which will give over $19 billion in funding to support measures to "increase testing and contact tracing to protect Canadians from future waves of the virus. It will help support the capacity of our health care systems, including through services for people facing mental health challenges. It will also provide municipalities with funding so they can quickly deliver essential services, like public transit, that Canadians rely on every day, and secure a reliable source of personal protective equipment for essential workers." As well as provide support to Canadian workers.

The Government of Canada announced August 6 that it will establish a $75-million dollar fund to "ensure minimum levels of essential transportation services to remote communities, and ensure the continued supply of food, medical supplies, and other essential goods and services."

Canada, the PM announced August 26 that there will be $2 billion in federal funding that is to "support provinces and territories through the Safe Return to Class Fund. This will provide the complementary funding they need, as they work alongside local school boards to ensure the safety of students and staff members throughout the school year. For example, the Fund will help provinces and territories by supporting adapted learning spaces, improved air ventilation, increased hand sanitation and hygiene, and purchases of personal protective equipment and cleaning supplies." There will also be an additional $112 million for First Nations for the sam purpose.
Canada--The Ministry of Health announced September 11 "$13.9 million in funding over 12 months for Toronto Public Health to establish a voluntary self-isolation centre."

Canada is announced that messaging on arrival screens at the Toronto, Montr "al and Vancouver international airports reminding travellers to inform a Border Services Officer if they are experiencing flu-like symptoms and an additional health screening question on electronic kiosks used by international travellers from January 25th.
The federal government of Canada is launching a $30-million national ad campaign Monday 23d to urge every Canadian to do their bit to help prevent the spread of the deadly COVID-19 virus.
On March 26th, Health Canada advised the public, as well as healthcare professionals (HCPs) to use caution when considering the use of homemade masks to protect against the transmission of COVID-19.

Canada, April 7 "Wearing a non-medical mask is another way of covering your mouth and nose to prevent your respiratory droplets from contaminating others or landing on surfaces. A cloth mask or face covering can reduce the chance that others are coming into contact with your respiratory droplets, in the same way that our recommendation to cover your cough with tissues or your sleeve can reduce that chance. 

For short periods of time when physical distancing is not possible in public settings (e.g., grocery shopping, in close settings such as public transit), wearing a non-medical mask is one way to protect those around you."

Canada, April 14 "Health Canada has received reports that fraudulent and uncertified N95 respirators that falsely claim to protect consumers against COVID-19 are being illegally sold to consumers online and in some stores."

Canada--Health Canada, the Canadian Digital Service (CDS), and Service Canada announced April 30 the introduction of an email based update subscription that sends "important and authoritative content on the Government of Canada "s COVID-19 website, Canada.ca/coronavirus," to subscribers.
Canada--"Government of Canada announces online tool,  "Find financial help during COVID-19 " to assist Canadians in accessing financial support. This tool was announced on May 22.

Canada has released an online course on August 17 to help businesses and organizations "across Canada safely return to work during the COVID-19 pandemic." 

"The course will guide employers, supervisors, managers and workers on how to prepare for a safe return to work, and what controls are needed to be put in place to protect everyone and minimize the impact of the pandemic."
Canada--Beginning March 2, travelers arriving from Iran will be asked to self-isolate for 14 days after entering the country
Canada--The federal government announced that beginning March 27 that all in-person Service Canada locations will be closed until further notice. Services will still be available via phone or online.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

description: Canada, "as of July 13, some national historic sites will re-open with limited visitor services. Locations may reduce the number of visitors allowed to enter at one time, to ensure physical distancing. Some areas, rooms or buildings may remain closed for health and safety reasons."
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

description: Canada--The Chief Medical Health Officer recommended March 22 to limit not have gatherings over 50 and to maintain social distance guidelines when together.

Canada, The Canada Games Council (CGC) announced September 16 the postponement of the Canada Summer Games until summer of 2022. The games were originally planned to be held August of 2021, but have been postponed to the following year.

Canada, April 5 "Prohibit all commercial marine vessels with a capacity of more than 12 passengers from engaging in non-essential activities, such as tourism or recreation. These measures will remain in place until at least June 30.
Require ferries and essential passenger vessel operators to:
Immediately reduce by 50% the maximum number of passengers that may be carried on board (conduct half-load voyages) to support the two-metre physical distancing rule; or Implement alternative practices to reduce the risk of spreading COVID-19 (consistent with Public Health Agency of Canada guidelines) among passengers on board their vessels, such as keeping people in their vehicles, when feasible or enhanced cleaning and hygiene measures."

Canada, April 5 "Prohibit all commercial marine vessels with a capacity of more than 12 passengers from engaging in non-essential activities, such as tourism or recreation. These measures will remain in place until at least June 30.

Require ferries and essential passenger vessel operators to:
Immediately reduce by 50% the maximum number of passengers that may be carried on board (conduct half-load voyages) to support the two-metre physical distancing rule; or
Implement alternative practices to reduce the risk of spreading COVID-19 (consistent with Public Health Agency of Canada guidelines) among passengers on board their vessels, such as keeping people in their vehicles, when feasible or enhanced cleaning and hygiene measures."
Canada, on April 7, the Public Health Agency of Canada is recommending citizens to wear non-medical face masks to help prevent possible COVID-19 transmission.
Chile suspends classes in educational establishments from March 16.
Chile enforces a nation-wide curfew from 22pm to 5am from March 22.
The curfew from 2pm to 10pm on Isla de Pascua will be suspended on April 6.
Chile issued a Declaration of emergency (State of catastrophy) for the next 90 days on March 19.
Chile forbids the landfall of cruise ships from March 15 to Sep. 30, 2020.
Chile conducts health examinations at the land borders. People with symptoms will be denied access to Chile from March 16.
Chile reduces journeys of civil servants to minimum from March 16.

On 22nd May, 2020, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Chile announced the partial reopening of the northern border with Peru to allow a number of Chilean nationals stranded in Peru (and Peruvian nationals stranded in Chile) to return to the country, under the current sanitary protocols and an entry schedule. The measure will last until 27th May, 2020.

Chile launches an online platform where passengers of buses have to register (ride >5 hrs) or can register (ride <5 hrs) any bus ride, including route, date and time and licence plate of the bus on March 6. If any infected person was travelling in the same bus, all registered passengers will be notified.
Chile plans to fortify its health resources by increase of the budget to pay health personnel over hours an additional purchasing of personal protective equipment.
Chilean Ministry of Health and chilean armed forces agree on March 10 to use hospitals and medical supplies of the armed forced for the treatment of Covid-19 patients if necessary.
Chile is tendering 11 new hospitals and commisioning 5 new hospitals between April and June of 2020,this was announced on Feb 25.
The Ministry of Health has received 72 ventilators on April 25, 117 ventilators on May 1 and 87 ventilators on May 9.
The first of five modular hospitals is opened in Puente Alto, Chile. With its 100 beds, it will contribute to meeting the increasing demand for hospital services.
The Chilean Ministry of Health allows non-prescription as well as prescription medication to be sold online.
The Ministry of Health has received 500.000 antibody tests (looking for IgM antibodies and IgG antibodies) to identify people who have already had COVID-19.
Chile announces that the test for Covid 19 will be covered by the health insurance from Feb 28.

The Health authorities announce the implementation of sanitary customs at bus stations. The measure will begin to operate on April 1 in the Metropolitan Region and will be gradually rolled out throughout the rest of Chile.
Chile "s CONAF (National forestry corporation) suspends visits to national parks, reserves and natural monuments due to COVID-19 protocol from March 17 until further notice.
A cordon sanitaire will be in place for Chill "n and Chill "n Viejo from March 23 onwards.
A cordon sanitaire will be in place for San Pedro de la Paz from March 25 onwards. The end date is not specified.
A cordon sanitaire will be in place for Chilo " beginning on March 26. The end date is not specified.
A cordon sanitaire will be in place for Temuco and Padre Las Casas beginning on March 28. The end date is not specified.
A cordon sanit "re will be in place for Osorno beginning on March 30. The end date is not specified.
A cordon sanitaire will be set up around Puerto Williams. The start date hasn't been specified.
A cordon sanitaire will be put in place for Hualp "n beginning on April 6. The end date is not specified.
A cordon sanitaire will be set up for Punta Arenas beginning on April 8. The end date has not been specified.
A cordon sanitaire will be put around the region Metropolitana and the urban area of Gran Concepci "n beginning on April 30 and ending on May 3.
A cordon sanitaire will be set up for San Antonio beginning on May 15. The end date has not been specified.
A cordon sanitaire will be in place for Alto Bob "o beginning on June 12. The end date has not been specified.
A cordon sanitaire will be in place for Pirque beginning on June 12. The end date has not been specified.
A cordon sanitaire will be put around Biob "o and Gran Valpara "so from June 26 to June 29.
A new legislation grants more lenient terms, such as house arrest, to some prisoners accused of low-level crimes to reduce the populations of crowded prisons.
Mask use is declared compulsory in any public transport or private paid transport from April 6 onwards.

The operation of all types of cemeteries prohibited from May 8 until May 10 May. The burial and burning of corpses, as well as any other activity whose health consequences make it impossible to postpone them, are exempt from the above-mentioned prohibition.
Chile sends travellers from Italy and Spain directly to 14 day domestic quarantine from March 10 on.

Chile puts first school in quarantine and updates the protocol of quarantine for educational establishments. In case a student has a direct relative with covid 19, she/he has to complete 14 day quarantine. If a student is infected with covid 19, his whole class will be quarantined. If two or more students or a employee of the school is covid-19 positive, the whole establishment will be quarantined for 14 days. This takes effect on March 13.
Chile is enforcing a two-week quarantine for nationals and permanent residents coming in from abroad.
Chile is enforcing a one-week quarantine for Lo Barnechea, Vitacura, Las Condes, Providencia, Santiago,  "u "oa and Independencia beginning on March 26 and ending on April 2.
Chile is enforcing a one-week quarantine for parts of Puente Alto (poniente del eje Vicu "a Mackenna y el centro de Puente Alto, la avenida Concha y Toro) beginning on April 9 and ending on April 16.

People who test positive for COVID-19 are obliged to stay in quarantine for at least 14 days until symptoms disappear (the start date ist the day when first symptoms occurred). The same applies to people who have been in contact with someone who tested positive for COVID-19. Being in contact is defined as (at least one bullet point must apply):
- Have maintained more than 15 minutes of face-to-face contact, less than a meter away.
- Have shared a closed space for 2 hours or more, such as places like offices, jobs, meetings, schools.
- Living or sleeping in the same home or home-like places, such as hostels, boarding schools, closed institutions, nursing homes, hotels, residences, among others.
- Having moved in any closed means of transport to a proximity of less than one meter with another occupant of the means of transport.
Chile is enforcing a quarantine for El Basque, Arica and parts of San Bernardo beginning on April 16 and ending on April 23.
Chile is enforcing a one-week quarantine for Angol beginning on April 30 and ending on May 7.
Chile is enforcing a one-week quarantine for Recoleta beginning on May 5 and ending on May 12.
Chile is enforcing a one-week quarantine for Mejillones beginning on May 5 and ending on May 12.
Chile is enforcing a one-week quarantine for the urban area of Antofagasta beginning on May 5 and ending on May 12.
Chile is enforcing a one-week quarantine for Lampa, Colina, Padre Hurtado and Buin beginning on May 15 and ending on May 22.
Chile is enforcing a one-week quarantine for Iquique and Alto Hospicio beginning on May 15 and ending on May 22.
Chile is enforcing a one-week quarantine for Lonquimay beginning on May 22 and ending on May 29.
Chile is enforcing a quarantine for Calama beginning on June 9 and ending on June 19.
Chile is enforcing a quarantine for San Antonio beginning on June 9 and ending on June 19.
Chile is enforcing a quarantine on Calama beginning on June 9 and ending on June 19.

Chile is enforcing a quarantine on , Vi "a del Mar, Valpara "so, Pe "aflor and the urban areas of Pozo Almonte, Melipilla, San Jos " de Maipo, Curacav " and Til Til beginning on June 12 and ending on June 19.
Chile is enforcing a one-week quarantine for San Felipe, Los Andes, Rancagua, Machal " and the urban area of Curic " beginning on June 19 and ending on June 26.
Chile is enforcing a quarantine for Tocopilla beginning on June 23 and ending on July 3.
Chile is enforcing a quarantine for Camera de Tango, El Monte, Talagante, Quillota and Graneros beginning on June 26 and ending on July 3.
Chile closes commercial centers except for essential businesses from March 19.
Chile closes down cinemas, theaters, restaurants, pubs, discotheques, sport events from March 21.
Chile bans public events with more than 500 people from March 16.
Chile is forbidding access to retirement homes and closing down establishments for entertainment of elderly people starting from March 16 and valid for one month.
Chile closes it "s urban parks from March 17 for undefined time. It is an effort to fulfill the requirements of Social distancing.
China "s State Council announced that the Lunar New Year / Spring Festival holiday will be extended to February 2 across the country.
Schools in China are closed until further notice.

On February 17, China "s Ministry of Education launched a national online learning platform and started broadcasting primary school classes on public TV to help 180 million students  "keep learning even with classes suspended "

On March 18, China  "s Ministry of Foreign Affairs advised Chinese citizens not to travel to Italy, Spain, France, Germany, the USA, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Austria, Belgium, Iran and South Korea

China is further reducing international passenger flights from March 26. Each Chinese airline is only allowed to maintain one route to any specific country with no more than one flight per week; each foreign airline is only allowed to maintain one route to China with no more than one weekly flight.
From March 28, China temporarily suspends entry by foreign nationals holding visas or residence permits still valid to the time of the announcement on March 26
China has suspended all passenger transport services at land, river and sea ports of entry by March 30

On April 2, China  "s Ministry of Foreign Affairs advised Chinese citizens not to travel to Italy, the USA, Spain, Germany, Iran, France, South Korea, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Belgium, Austria, Norway,  Portugal, Sweden, Australia, Brazil, Turkey, Malaysia, Denmark, Canada, Israel, Czech Republic, Ireland, the Philippines and Thailand
Heilongjiang province which is next to Russia has locked down the border from Aprial 10  because several infected people from Russia came into China and has caused more than 100 new infections

On February 22, the joint prevention and control mechanism of China "s State Council issued a guideline on the resumption in enterprises " production and institutions " operation, stressing that epidemic-prevention measures should be well carried out in workplace. All units should constantly monitor staff members " health conditions.
From March 19, all international passenger flights bound for Beijing will be diverted to three designated first points of entry

On April 6, China published new rules to intensify detection of asymptomatic novel coronavirus cases and standardize management procedures. 

New rules include swift reporting of symptom-free cases and tracking of their close contacts, vigorous testing to screen out undetected cases and prolonged medical monitoring.
On February 13, the first batch of 1400 army medics of the Chinese People "s Liberation Army arrived in Wuhan

On January 26, Chinese Center For Disease Control and Prevention announced that they had started to develop a vaccine against the deadly coronavirus. Researchers had isolated viruses and were selecting a strain.
On January 26, the national team of 121 medics arrived in Wuhan to help battle coronavirus
On January 30, China "s State Council urged provinces to resume production of medical materials related to epidemic control

On February 10, China "s State Council issues measures to improve the working conditions of medical workers on the front line against the novel coronavirus and to care for their physical and mental health
On February 17, the second batch of 1000 army medics of the Chinese People "s Liberation Army arrived in Wuhan

China sends 500 Real Time PCR to Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR), Bangladesh for better detection capability of coronavirus. Announced on February 16, received February 20.

On February 22, the leading group of the CPC Central Committee on the prevention and control of the novel coronavirus outbreak released a guideline to implement measures of further protecting and caring for medical workers.
On February 24, China's Joint Prevention and Control Mechanism of the State Council mandated the wearing of masks on public transportation

On March 4, the leading group of the CPC Central Committee on the Prevention and Control of the COVID-19 Outbreak released a guideline to implement measures to protect and care for community workers who fight the epidemic at the frontline in urban and rural areas.

On March 14, it was announced that Chinese doctors were coming to work in Tunisia. Stocks of antibacterial gels and protective masks will also be supplied by China. According to Doctor Dhaker Lahidheb, a doctor practicing at the Tunis Military Hospital, a team of high-level Chinese doctors will soon travel to Tunisia, provided with effective drugs designed, according to him, to fight against the coronavirus.
In a statement released the same evening, the Presidency of the Republic of Tunisia welcomed the Chinese initiative.
On March 17, China's Joint Prevention and Control Mechanism of the State Council issued a public guideline on wearing face masks
The Republic of South Africa's National Defence Force (SANDF) receives a "donation of medical protective gear" from the People's Republic of China Armed Forces on March 26 2020

On April 11, Suzhou Institute of Biomedical Engineering and Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences announced that a new nucleic acid test kit for COVID-19, which can confirm cases in 45 minutes on average, has been developed. It has completed clinical trials on more than 600 samples with an accuracy rate of more than 99 percent and has been approved by the National Medical Products Administration for sale and clinical use.
China donated several health resources to Comoros to assist its fight against Covid-19. (10th April)
The Chinese Foreign Minister, Wang Yi has said that his country will provide Libya with as many medical supplies it could for tackling the Corona virus epidemic.
On April 14, China "s State Council joint prevention and control mechanism against the coronavirus announced that two COVID-19 inactivated vaccine candidates have been approved for clinical trials
Hungary received three million face masks, two million gloves and 164 ventilators from China

The medical supplies jointly donated by Jack Ma Foundation & Alibaba Foundation to Timor-Leste arrived at the Dili airport by a cargo plane on May 26 2020. This is the second shipment from China to Timor-Leste.

A medical expert team sent by the Chinese government arrived on June 08 to support Bangladesh's fight against the COVID-19 pandemic. The 10-member team, organized by China's National Health Commission, consists of experts from Hainan, the southernmost island province of China. Announced on April 26.

From 3th April, China government requires to strengthen the detection of new coronaviruses in airports of Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou and Tianjin, Shijiazhuang, Taiyuan and other 12 cities to input relevant requirements for the prevention of out-of-region outbreaks.
Reported on April 15, China launched study into asymptomatic cases and shared immunity. The research will be conducted in six provinces.
On April 18, China "s National Health Commission mandated coronavirus tests for key public workers leaving Wuhan. The government of Hubei province will pay for the tests.
On April 18, China "s National Health Commission encouraged workers other than key public workers leaving Wuhan to take voluntary coronavirus tests.

On June.09, New Zealand is enforcing a health testing "People entering New Zealand are already required to stay in managed isolation, everyone in managed isolation will be tested twice for COVID-19 and will require a negative result before they leave. ."
China requested Hubei Airports Group to reduce Wuhan-related flights on January 23
From January 24, China Railway offered a full refund for all train tickets.
China requested airlines and ticket sales agents to offer on request free ticket refund to passengers of all flights on January 23
On January 27, China "s Ministry of Transport ordered that all passengers of land and water transportation would be offered free refund on request from January 28
China requested airlines and ticket sales agents to offer on request free ticket refund or rebooking to student passengers of flights departing until end of March on February 11
China is resuming operations for domestic passenger flights of Wuhan Tianhe International Airport from April 8

China, starting from Jan. 23: Huanggang, one of the worst hit cities in Hubei, had imposed a similar lockdown starting on Thursday at midnight. As of that time, there had been 3,009 confirmed cases in Xiaogan and 2,791 ones in Huanggang. Starting from March 22, Huanggang City will cancel the physical closure of the community from now on, and the community will be managed by the property company or the owners " committee. The entry and exit of the community will not be restricted by one household or one person.
On Dec 31 2019, a group of experts from the Chinese National Health Commission arrived in Wuhan for an investigation
On January 8, the second group of experts from the Chinese National Health Commission arrived in Wuhan for investigation

On January 11, a consortium of researchers published a draft genome of the newly discovered coronavirus on online platforms. Wuhan Institute of Virology shared the genome sequence with the World Health Organization
On January 18, a high-level expert group sent by the Chinese National Health Commission arrived in Wuhan
On January 20, China's National Health Commission published the first version of China's Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia Diagnosis and Treatment Plan
From January 22, patients with pneumonia caused by the novel coronavirus are able to get subsidies to cover their medical costs

On January 28, China "s Supreme People "s Court issued a lengthy article on its social media account reprimanding Wuhan police for being so quick to take action against information that, it noted, was substantially true
On January 29, the Communist Party of China (CPC) Central Committee issued circular pledging political support for battling novel coronavirus

On February 17, China "s State Council's joint prevention and control mechanism released a circular calling for the adoption of differentiated measures for county-level regions to curb the novel coronavirus outbreak based on each region's epidemic situation.

On February 24, China "s State Council's joint prevention and control mechanism released a circular specifying epidemic prevention and control technical plans tailored for organizations and venues of various kinds, including medical institutions, communities, offices and public areas, malls and supermarkets, stations of public transportation, schools and universities, prisons and care homes
On March 5, the Communist Party of China (CPC) Central Committee and the State Council unveiled a guideline on deepening the reform of the country's medical insurance system.
On March 15, China "s State Council announced measures to protect unattended children amid epidemic
China will postpones 'gaokao' college entrance exams by one month to July 7 and 8. Hubei province and capital Beijing will be allowed to put forward opinions on their own timetables for the tests.
On April 4, China mourned COVID-19 victims

On April 08, China "s State Council issued a circular calling for differentiated measures in the workplace and public places, based on each region's epidemic situation.

For regions at low-level risk, places essential for work and life, as well as open-air sites, should be reopened gradually. Mass gatherings should be held prudently. The reopening of places for entertainment and leisure activities should be carefully considered.

On Feb. 20 The general Council of China in Recife joined an event and ask the Brazilians workers not to treat with prejudice the Chinese that live in Brazil. She informed that all Chinese people arriving from China are on quarantine.

On August 13, China has agreed to supply coronavirus vaccines to Pakistan to conduct tests. If the results prove effective, Pakistan will ensure its most vulnerable segment of the population  " elderly, health-care workers and people with medical conditions associated with serious cases of COVID-19

On January 4, National Institute for Communicable Disease Control and Prevention, Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention said in a media interview that there had been no obvious evidence of human-to-human transmission
On January 9,  Chinese scientists announced in a media interview that a novel coronavirus had been identified as the main causative agent
On January 20, China "s National Health Commission confirmed the first cases of human-to-human transmission of the virus

On January 20, Chinese President Xi publicly addressed the crisis for the first time in a directive urging party committees and governments at all levels to take measures to curb the spread of the epidemic

China: to guide the prevention and control of the coronavirus infections, experts organized by the National Health Committee revised the "Biosafety Guidelines for New Coronavirus Laboratories" (Third Edition)

China: to prevent and control the coronavirus infections, the National Health Committee organized the "Technical Guidelines for the Prevention and Control of New Coronavirus Infections in Medical Institutions (Part 1 Edition))". Meanwhile, the name, contact number, office, position and other information of the special person in charge of the provincial health administrative department to the Medical and Medical Administration of our committee should be collected before 10:00 on January 23, 2020

China: to guide the prevention and control of the coronavirus infections, experts organized by the National Health Committee revised the "Biosafety Guidelines for New Coronavirus Laboratories" (Second Edition) and distributed to all provincial and municipal health commissions.
On January 27, China's National Health Commission urged the public to stay at home, not to go to epidemic areas and avoid public and crowded places during the extended holiday
On January 27, China urged migrant workers who returned from cities to wear masks, wash hands frequently, avoid gatherings and crowded places
Ministry of education of China postpones the National College Entrance Examination (GAOKAO) from June 7th/8th to July 7th/8th.
From April 1, China began publishing asymptomatic infections in its daily briefings.
China delivered official announcement for public awareness of the normalised status of coping with corona virus on 6th May within mainland China.

China, announced on January 26: for better use of medical supplies, the National Health Commission has organized experts to formulate the "Guidelines for the Use of Common Medical Protective Products in the Prevention and Control of New Coronavirus Pneumonia (Trial)"
From January 26, China suspends wildlife trade to curb novel coronavirus
On February 24, China's legislature adopts decision on banning illegal trade, consumption of wildlife

On February 25, China "s National Development and Reform Commission said regions at low risk of virus should  "completely restore work and life procedures ", end all restrictions on transportation and help enterprises resolve funding and raw material problems

China will send investigation and research teams in mid-March to some provincial-level regions in the country to check the progress of their work and production resumption as the coronavirus outbreak subsides
New Zealand is enforcing a  restriction and regulation of business. "Business must maintain contact tracing records and maintain a minimum one metre between customers." on May 14th
On February 24,  China postponed the annual session of the Chinese People "s Political Consultative Conference
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

description: On February 24,  China's top legislature voted to postpone this year's NPC annual session
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

description: Director general of the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention  Gao Fu urged the Chinese public not to gather for Chinese New Year celebration on an interview with CCTV on January 24

Chinese government announced the regulation for normalising the virus coping measures including social distancing, restriction in mass gathering, health test and monitoring, sterilisation in schools, public places, and strengthen scientific research in COVID-19. The policy was announced at 8th May 2020.
Colombia is enforcing the closure of all schools and universities starting on March 16
Colombia anounced the health emergency on March 11
Colombia took the decision to decree a State of Emergency, in accordance with Article 215 of the Political Constitution of Colombia.
Colombia  suspended transit and disembarkation of cruise ships in Colombia on March. 11(resolution 385 of 2020).

Colombia is colsing the border crossings with Venezuela as a protection measure in view of the situation in the neighbouring country. 
Restricting the entry into the country of persons who are neither citizens nor residents and who have been in Europe and Asia during the last 14 days. Colombians who have been in these places will be subject to mandatory preventive isolation and all controls to ensure compliance with the measures.
Colombia is enforcing  restricted entry to any international traveler (all passeners, inclusing colombian natinoals)  to Colombia, regardless of their origin or background starting March 23
Colombia is not allowing any international flights for its citizens until August 31st, starting on June 1st.

Colombia is enforcing the use of masks for everyone who has simtoms of corona/flu, in the case you have had contact to a confirmed corona case and for medical staff/persons in contact with persons with symptoms at workon Feb. 25.

Colombia is granting life insurance coverage to 585,000 health workers, covering those who die as a result of COVID-19. It is free of charge, no pre-existence, no age limit, no income requirement, and no limit to time of stay. It covers retroactively as of March 2nd until December 31st. It will be administered by FASECOLDA through private insurers.

Colombia announced on March 18 that additional resources areallocated to the health system to facilitate the acquisition of medical equipment, have greater testing capabilities available and provide liquidity resource. 
Accelerate the necessary mechanisms for the implementation of the end point scheme to inject liquidity and pay off historical debts of the health system, guaranteeing the operation of the network and the arrival of the necessary technologies to care for the most critical patients.

Colombia has announced that the purchase of the first 1,510 fans for the country was signed. Within the contingency plan to prepare the health system, fans are a very important element. The Ministry also stressed that the safety of health workers is a priority, so together with the Ministry of Labour, resources were secured to guarantee protective elements for health professionals: kits to be distributed to every doctor, assistant and technician in Colombia so that they have their protective elements on March 27.

Colombia has taken steps to ensure the availability, accessibility, equity, continuity, and timeliness of the health service on April 04
State entities have the possibility of advancing and closing negotiations that guarantee the availability of medical devices and personal protection elements by going to the international market, it was determined that contracts that have as their objective the acquisition of medical devices and personal protection elements in the international market will not be governed by the General Statute for Public Administration Contracting, and the norms of private law will be applicable.

In Colombia the Ministry of Science, Technology & Innovations opens a Call for the strengthening of regional laboratories with the potential to provide scientific and technological services to address problems associated with biological agents at high risk for human health.

Colombia announced that the first 47,500 rapid tests for covid-19 arrived in the country. These tests will enter a validation process and will later be applied in clinics throughout the country on April 08
Colombia called on the entire productive sector of the country to produce elements of medical protection starting April 13

Colombia announced to  eliminate VAT on the import and sale of 211 medical goods, such as mouthpieces, health equipment and respirators, among others, which are necessary to deal with this pandemic starting April 15

Colombia  announced a Decree under which technical reserves can be used on April 23. This is 1.7 trillion pesos, which will be used to pay debts to hospitals and providers for services and technologies included in the Benefits Plan. The EPSs will distribute the amount of the technical reserves equitably among as many providers and suppliers as possible. They cannot distribute them among their own companies and we will be following up with the Superintendent of Health.

Colombia defined a special support of resources to settle outstanding debts with the health workers in the country.
After identifying the amount of the arrears with health workers under the different contracting modalities in the country, the Government managed to collect the money for the payment of the debts that have been generated from January to March of this year worth $273 billion.

Colombia has announced that two new robots (Hamilton brand) arrived on April 25th at the INS virology laboratory and will be operated after all the necessary tests and formal delivery by the supplier. When they are working simultaneously, they will process around 2,300 samples per day, generating speed and efficiency in the processes.
Colombia is increases its capacity to carry out tests throughout the territory  on May 11

Colombia has implemented the following procedures for domestic flights: Passengers must arrive two hours in advance of their flight's scheduled time with electronic check-up when possible; Passengers must carry only personal bags that can be stored under the passenger's chair, all others must be checked; It will be recommended to make use of the CoronApp-Colombia app to keep health information; Certain airports will have restricted admissions for workers only; All people entering the airport will have their temperature taken with a contactless thermometer; All persons must use personal protective equipment; Passengers arriving at the air terminals for flights should immediately go to the boarding rooms; Workers will clean up all areas; Passenger registration will be taken at the pre-boarding stage; All are required to respect the physical distancing of 2 meters in areas such as counters, scanners and in the queues for aircraft boarding; Boarding will be authorized only when the aircraft is ready; The aircraft will not be serviced on board; Passengers not to use onboard entertainment systems such as screens and mobile phones; Aircraft bathrooms should not be used if possible; Passengers must remain seated during the flight; All airport and airline personnel will be trained to identify biological hazard situations; Passengers given directions for disembarkation; Passengers must go directly to exit; Passengers must report symptoms within 14 days. Starts on July 1st.

Colombian domestic air transport is not yet allowed as of June 1st. Domestic air transport is only permitted by: humanitarian emergency, transport of cargo and goods and fortuitous case or force majeure.
Colombia is extending mandatory preventive isolation until the 1st of August, starting on July 7th.

Colombia announced app to track COVID-19 (CoronApp-Colombia) starting March 15. Aims to register friends or family members to report news about their health status and receive news and prevention advice. It also contains various phone numbers people can reach out to in case of an emergency. The app is for free

Colombia announced that during the 20 days of quarantine the operation of the public transport service will be allowed up to 20%, which will be sufficient for the mobilization of all those people working in the health sector and in those establishments that have been exempted by the preventive isolation rule.
