"Passengers (foreign and Indian) other than those restricted, arriving directly or indirectly from China, South Korea, Japan, Iran, Italy, Hong Kong, Macau, Vietnam, Malaysia, Indonesia, Nepal, Thailand, Singapore and Taiwan must undergo medical screening at port of entry."

India issues Visa Suspension  " 
"All regular (sticker) Visas/e-Visa (including VoA for Japan and South Korea) granted to nationals of Italy, Iran, South Korea, Japan and issued on or before 03.03.2020 and who have not yet entered India, stand suspended with immediate effect. Such foreign nationals may not enter India from any Air, Land or Seaport ICPs. Those requiring to travel to India due to compelling reasons, may seek fresh visa from nearest Indian Embassy/Consulate."

India issues following restriction on international cruise ship members / passengers  " 
"Any international cruise ship or any member of its crew or any passenger therein having a travel history of visiting any of the Covid-19 affected countries mentioned in the adjoining link (https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus2019/situation-reports) since 1st Feb, 2020; will not be permitted to enter any
Indian port till 31st March, 2020."

India issues operating procedure for international cruise ships  " 
"Only those international cruise ships which had planned and intimated their call to an Indian Port not later than 1st January, 2020 will be allowed to call on such port."

India issues following entry condition  "
"passengers traveling from /having visited Italy or Republic of Korea and desirous of entering India will need certificate of having tested negative for COVID-19 from the designated laboratories authorized by the health
authorities of these countries."

India issued following travel restriction  " 
"Regular visas (including e Visas) granted to all foreign nationals who have
travel history to these countries on or after 1.2.2020 and who have not yet
entered India also stands suspended. "

India issued following travel restriction  "
"all regular Visas (including e Visas) which have been granted to nationals of France, Germany and Spain on or before 11.03.2020 and where these foreigners have not yet entered India stands suspended. "
India issues intensified health inspections at remaining Land Check Posts on Indo-Bhutan, Indo-Nepal, Indo-Myanmar, Indo-Bangladesh borders.

India issues following policy  " 
"Visa free travel facility granted to OCI card holders is kept in abeyance till April 15th 2020. This will come into effect from 1200 GMT on 13th March 2020 at the port of departure."

India issues following travel advisory  " "
"All existing visas, except diplomatic, official, UN/International Organizations, employment, project visas, stand suspended till 15th April 2020. This will come into effect from 1200 GMT on 13th March
2020 at the port of departure. "
India issues suspends international passenger traffic through Land Check Posts along following borders  " Indo-Bangladesh, Indo-Nepal, Indo-Bhutan, Indo-Myanmar (few check posts are exceptions).
India suspends operation of India-Bangladesh cross border Passenger Train and Buses

India  " 
"Travel of passengers from Afghanistan, Philippines, Malaysia to India is prohibited with immediate effect. No flight shall take off from these countries to India after 1500 hours Indian Standard Time (IST)."
India issued travel restriction on Passengers from UK and Turkey

India issues travel restriction  " 
"Travel of passengers from member countries of the European Union, the European Free Trade Association, Turkey and United Kingdom to India is prohibited with effect from 18th March 2020. "

India issues following restriction  " 
"No scheduled international commercial passenger aircraft shall take off from any foreign airport for any airport in India, after 0001 hrs GMT of March 22, 2020 (*i.e. 0531 hrs Indian Standard Time (IST) of March 22, 2020)"

According to an official statement released on 21 February 2020, the Secretary for India's Health and Family Welfare (HFW) ministry said that states were advised to regularly update requisite information pertaining to screening and surveillance accurately and in a timely manner on the web portal that was  put in place as a special surveillance web tool to monitor cases on a real-time basis at the national level

On 2 March 2020, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said that India was working towards evacuating Indians stranded in Iran amid coronavirus outbreak. They were collaborating with Tehran to set up a screening process for returning Indians.

Indian government launched a mobile app on 2nd April 2020 called  "AarogyaSetu " which will enable people to assess themselves the risk for their catching the Corona Virus infection. It will calculate this based on their interaction with others, using cutting edge Bluetooth technology, algorithms, and artificial intelligence. The app also aims to tell people about the 'best' practices they can follow and the apt sources they can refer to so that people can cope well with the ongoing virus outbreak.

According to an official statement, the Secretary for India's Health and Family Welfare (HFW) ministry added that States and Union Territories (UTs) have reported that the protocols and guidelines issued by the central government are being followed to avoid any eventuality along with sufficient stocks for Personal Protection Equipment (PPEs) and masks have been procured.

India suspended exports of some medical items on 23 February 2020. The government's decision for the prohibition of specific exports came after waiting for China's permission to send a special Indian flight for the evacuation of remaining Indian citizens in Wuhan.
India yesterday provided 30,000 surgical masks and 15,000 head covers to Bangladesh to help its efforts in combating the coronavirus pandemic. March 25

Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) writes to States/UTs to ensure smooth Disbursal of Money to beneficiaries of PMGKY during 21-day Lockdown to fight COVID-19. 
- The Department of Financial Services, Ministry of Finance had issued detailed guidelines on the disbursal of money to beneficiaries of Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojana (PM-GKY) through banks, 21-day lockdown to fight COVID-19.
- In pursuance of these guidelines, Secretary, Union Ministry for Home Affairs (MHA), Shri Ajay Kumar Bhalla has written to all States/UTs requesting them to take all necessary measures to ensure smooth disbursal of money to the beneficiaries of PM-GKY, while observing norms of social distancing.

Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) writes to States to give special attention on keeping the supply of Medical Oxygen smooth and hassle-free across the country.
- As part of maintaining a smooth supply of essential items in the country, Union Home Secretary, Shri Ajay Kumar Bhalla has written to all State Chief Secretaries to give special attention on keeping the supply of medical oxygen smooth and hassle-free. 
- It has been emphasized upon as there is a critical need to maintain adequate supply of medical oxygen in the country in the wake of COVID-19 Pandemic and medical oxygen is also included in the national list and WHO's a list of essential medicines.

Ministry of Health & Family Welfare - Directorate General of Health Services (EMR Division) 

Advisory for Managing Health care workers working in COVID and Non-COVID areas of the hospital

Fixation of rate for rt PCR test for COVID-19 in respect of medical attendance benificiary

Medical claim for the reimbursement shall be submitted by the beneficiary

Guidelines for international arrivals by Government of India
Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

While onboard the flight/ ship, required precautions such as wearing of masks, environmental
hygiene, respiratory hygiene, hand hygiene, etc. are to be observed by airline/ ship staff, crew
and all passengers.

Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) orders the restricting movement of migrants and strict enforcement of lockdown measures. 
-State/Union territories asked to ensure adequate arrangements of temporary shelters, and the provision of food, etc. 
-The migrant people, who have moved out to reach their home states/ home towns, must be kept in the nearest shelter by the respective State/ Union Territory government. 
-All the employers shall make payment of wages of their workers, at their workplaces, on the due date, without any deduction. 
- Wherever the workers, including the migrants, are living in the rented accommodation, the landlords of the properties shall not demand payment of rent for a period of one month. 
- If any landlord is forcing laborers and students to vacate their premises, they will be liable for action under the act.

Standard operating protocol (SOP) for movement of stranded workers by Train - Due to lockdown, migrant workers are stranded at different places. They are allowed to move by train new protocols. This is imposed by the government of India Ministry of Home Affairs.
Guidelines for domestic travel (air/train/inter-state bus travel) by Government of India Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the world "s largest lockdown on 24 March, asking 1.3 billion Indians to stay home for 21 days to slow the spread of COVID-19.
Government of India issues Orders prescribing lockdown for containment of COVID19 Epidemic in the country

Home Secretary guides to all Chief Secretaries Administrators DGPs and CP Delhi for ensuring lockdown measures during ensuing festivals.
- In view of the ensuring festivals in the months of April 2020, it is requested to ensure strict compliance of lockdown measures and not allow any social/religious gathering/procession. 
- District authorities and field agencies should be informed on the specific prohibitions as mentioned above and they should take all required precautionary/ preventive measures for maintenance of law and order, peace and public tranquility.
Ministry of Home Affairs extends the lockdown nationwide for 2 weeks to contain the spread of COVID-19.

Constitution of the Empowered Groups under the Disaster Management Act 2005. 

- Constituting eleven empowered Groups of Officers to identify problem areas and provide effective solutions therefor. 
- The Empowered Group shall take into consideration special instructions given to the Departments vide Department of Expenditure and will take suitable decisions/ make recommendations in this regard. 
- During the deliberations, if any of the Empowered Groups is of the view that a particular aspect is not within the domain of that Group and falls within the scope of any other Group(s), they may seek the guidance of the Cabient Secretary.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description:
India issues following plan for nationals in Italy  " "
"Provision for testing primarily for students/compassionate cases in Italy to be made and collection for samples to be organized accordingly. Those tested negative will be allowed to travel and will be
quarantined on arrival in India for 14 days."

India  " "Finance Minister announces Rs 1.70 Lakh Crore relief package under Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojana for the poor to help them fight the battle against Corona Virus" [Rs. 1.70 Lakh Crore = INR 1.70 Trillion]

India's Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Raveesh Kumar said that the Indian Air Force will be sending a C-17 Globemaster aircraft to China on February 20 with emergency medical supplies as a token of support to China and on its return journey, evacuate Indian nationals from Wuhan.
Ministry of Home Affairs - Policy regarding and fro of migrant workers are allowed from railway station to home on the basis of the confirmed e-ticket

The Union Health Ministry of India on 3rd August revised guidelines for international arrivals wherein passengers flying to India from August 8 can skip institutional quarantine if they submit COVID-19 negative test reports.

India's Minister of Health and Family Welfare Dr. Harsh Vardhan urged all states to keep high vigil and advised them to continue enhancing personal hygiene awareness for prevention amongst the masses.

India issues public awareness for Visa Extensions  " 
"Visas of all foreigners already in India remain valid and they may contact the nearest FRRO/FRO through e-FRRO module for extension/conversion etc of their visa or grant of any consular service, if they choose to do so."

Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) writes to States to widely publicize the Penal Provisions regarding Violations of Lockdown Measures to fight COVID-19.
- Strict Action to be taken by Authorities on Violators of Lockdown Measures: MHA to States
Ministry of Home Affairs has issued helpline numbers for all the States and Union Territories to combat COVID-19.

Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) writes to States/UTs to take measures to fight Fake News in order to prevent Panic among People and spread of COVID-19 in India. 
- The government of India is creating a web-portal for people to verify facts and unverified news promptly. 
- States/UTs have been requested to create a similar mechanism at their level for issues relating to them.

MHA writes to States to ensure Smooth Harvesting and Sowing Operations, while maintaining Social Distancing, during 21-day Lockdown to fight COVID-19.
- The Union Ministry for Home Affairs (MHA) had sent an advisory to all States regarding granting of an exception to Agricultural operations from lockdown restrictions to fight COVID-19, keeping in mind the harvesting and sowing season. 
- With this advisory, exceptions have been allowed for farming operations by farmers and farm workers, procurement of agricultural productions, operation of Mandis, movement of harvesting and sowing related machinery, etc.
Ministry of Health and Family Welfare - Public Awareness measures, video posted on youtube
Public Awareness about the general guidelines for COVID-19 by the ministry of health and family welfares
India  "is enforcing a two-week quarantine on all passengers, including Indian nationals arriving from or having visited China, Italy, Iran, Republic of Korea, France, Spain and Germany after Feb. 15

India issues quarantine for Indians returning from China  " "
"People travelling to China henceforth will be quarantined on return. "

India issues quarantine  " 
"People coming from Republic of Korea, Iran and Italy or those having history of travel to these countries may be quarantined for 14 days on arrival to India."

India issues Port screening protocol (conditions for quarantine) " 
"If any passengers/crew show symptoms of the disease, disembarking of such passengers/crew will not be permitted. The passenger will be quarantined on the ship. Samples of the patient will be collected and sent to designated hospital/lab for testing. If sample is tested positive, the passenger will be taken to the isolation facility attached to the Port and the ship will be asked to move out. "

India issues advisory for self quarantine  " 
"all passengers having travel history to China, Hong Kong, Republic of
Korea, Japan, Italy, Thailand, Singapore, Iran, Malaysia, France, Spain and Germany are advised to undergo self-imposed quarantine for a period of 14 days from the date of their arrival."

India issued the following quarantine policy  "
"All incoming travellers, including Indian nationals, arriving from or having visited China, Italy, Iran, Republic of Korea, France, Spain and Germany after 15th February, 2020 shall be quarantined for a minimum period of 14 days. This will come into effect from 1200 GMT on 13th March 2020 at the port of departure. "

India issues 14 day quarantine rules based on 1. travel history (to Italy, Iran, China, Spain, France, Germany, South Korea) and 2. symptomatic passengers across remaining open Land Check Posts (Indo-Bangladesh, Indo-Nepal, Indo-Bhutan, Indo-Myanmar borders).

India issues Quarantine  " 
" compulsory quarantine for a minimum period of 14 days for passengers
coming from/transiting through UAE, Qatar, Oman, and Kuwait."

Ministry of Home Affairs issues guidelines on the measures to be taken by Ministries/ Departments of Government of India, State/Union Territory Authorities for containment of COIVD-19 Epidemic in the country.

Guidelines for international arrivals by Government of India
Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
In India, Delhi airport on 21th July 2020 has announced 7-day quarantine for all the passengers arriving from abroad.

Ministry of Home Affairs issues guidelines on the measures to be taken by Ministries/ Departments of Government of India, State/Union Territory Authorities for containment of COIVD-19 Epidemic in the country.
Due to the outbreak of COVID-19 pandemic, first phase of Census 2021 and updation of NPT postponed until further orders

description: India shuts down offices of the Govt. of India, its Autonomous/Subordinate Offices and Public Corporations from 25th March 2020. The offices of the State/Union Territories, their autonomous bodies, Corporations etc shall also remain closed from 25th March 2020
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

description: Ministry of Home Affairs issues guidelines on the measures to be taken by Ministries/ Departments of Government of India, State/Union Territory Authorities for containment of COIVD-19 Epidemic in the country.

National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) has directed all Ministries / Departments of Government of India, State Governments and State Authorities to take measures for ensuring social distancing so as to prevent the spread of COVID-19 among the country.

Ministry of Home Affairs issues advisory to all States/Union Territories to make adequate arrangements for migrant workers, students, etc from outside the States to facilitate Social Distancing for COVID-19. 

- The advisory suggests that in order to mitigate the situation for unorganized sector workers, particularly stranded migrant workers, States/UTs need to explore measures by involving various agencies, including NGOs, to provide food and shelter with basic amenities like clean drinking water, sanitation, etc. 
- MHA has also advised that States/ UTs need to ensure that hotels, rented accommodations, hostels, etc., continue to remain functional and delivery of essential items is streamlined, so that students, working women hostel inmates, etc. are allowed to continue in existing facilities while observing precautions.

On April 14, The Irish Government has said there is "no truth" to conspiracy theories linking the spread of coronavirus with 5G. Liz Canavan Senior Official in the Department of the Taoiseach urged people to 'ignore misinformation' in a press briefing in Dublin.

On July 20, A new report by the Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport (DCMS) Select Committee has urged the Ireland Government to appoint an online harms regulator to hold online platforms to account. The report highlighted the spread of false claims online linking 5G to the virus, resulting in threats being made against telecoms engineers, as a clear sign of the dangers misinformation can pose.
On Mar 19 the Department for Education and Skills of Ireland released that the "leaving certificate and junior cycle oral and practical tests will be cancelled and students will get full marks".

On 7 August, the Minister for Education has announced an update to reopen schools fully at the end of the summer. All teachers in both primary and secondary schools, staff and students in secondary school are recommended to wear face coverings when a physical distance of two metres cannot be maintained.
On March 24, the Ireland Government announced that people need to stay at home and only leave to go to work, shop for essentials, care for others, exercise.

On Mar 24 Ireland advised its citizens to "only leave home to go to work if you cannot work from home and your attendance is essential. you should only go to the shops for essential supplies, out for medical or dental appointments, to care for others or to take physical exercise" until Apr 19.

On Mar 27 Ireland asked all "citizens over 70 or those extremely medically vulnerable to cocoon and to strictly avoid contact with someone displaying symtoms of Covid-19, not to leave your house, not to attend any gatherings and neither go out for shopping and stay in touch using remote technology" until Apr 12.
On Mar 12 Ireland stated that they are now moving from Containment Phase (Declaration of Emergency) into Delay Phase.
On Feb 20 the Minister for Health of the Republic of Ireland "signed regulations making Covid-19 a notifable disease." He stated that Ireland was now in Containment Phase.

On Mar 20th the Minister for Justice in Ireland "announced that immigration permissions due to expire between 20 March and 20 May will be automatically extended for two months." (External Border Restrictions)
On Mar 24 Ireland announced that "all cruise ship travel has to cease" until Apr 19.

On Mar 28 Ireland announced that "the arrival of personal non-national maritime leisure vessels is banned (except to exceptions as "port in a storm")" until Apr 12 as part of external border restrictions.

On May 22, the Ireland Government announced that effect from May 28 until June 18 all passengers arriving into the country will be legally required to complete a passenger locator form. It will be an offense not to fill in a passenger location form included fines of up to  "2,500.
Island of Ireland records first day with no coronavirus deaths since March- but quarantine for travellers will continue

According to Phase 2 of Ireland's Roadmap on June 5, the government and the department of health announced that all non-essential overseas travel to and from Ireland should be avoided. Passengers arriving from outside the island of Ireland are expected to self-isolate for 14 days.

Ireland's minister for Health announced new measures on Apr 4 assisting residents and staff of nursing homes: "staff screening will start in nursing homes twice a day, testing will be prioritised for stadd and HSE will provide access to PPE, etc." for a three-month period.
From 17 March to 26 March there have been several GAA stadiums opened as additional test services in Ireland.

On March 22, Ireland Government announced that almost 40,000 sample test kits are being distributed. Another 20,000 will be in Ireland by March 25, the health service said. The equipment purchased to tackle Covid-19 are 11 million masks, 1 million face shields, 1 million goggles, 400,000 gowns and suits. Also, a total of 50 test centres are expected to be set up.
Ireland did not issue any guidance on wearing face masks yet. "Only healthcare workers must wear face masks. Sick people will be advised by their doctor when to use a mask."

The Irish government announced on Mar 24 that "private hospitals will effectively operate as public hospitals for the duration of the Emergency and all private and public patientes will be treated equally on a non-for-profit basis" until Apr 19 in order to extend the health resources in Ireland.

On March 24, Ireland Government announced that some 2,000 beds, nine laboratories and thousands of staff have been drafted into the public system. Ireland Health Minister said for the duration of this crisis the State will take control of all private hospital facilities and manage all of the resources for the common benefit of all of their people.

In Ireland from Apr 06 "the HSE will double the capacity to test for the coronavirus from this week, to around 4500 tests a day and a network of laboratories and 50 community test centres have been set up".

On 14 April, Minister for Health Simon Harris said between 25,000 and 30,000 tests had been sent to Germany and "well over" half of the results had been returned, with the remainder due back by next week

On April 12, the Ireland minister was speaking as he announced mental health resources to help people cope would all be brought together on the Government website gov.ie/together. The minister also said that 1,502 student nurses have applied to work as paid healthcare assistants and that those applications were now being processed.

On April 26, The Minister for Health, Simon Harris, has announced an additional  "1.1 million euro investment in online mental health supports to help people, especially health services staff, manage their mental health during and following the COVID-19 pandemic.

On April 26, Minister for Health Simon Harris has announced an additional  "1.1 million euro investment in online mental health supports to help people, especially health services staff, manage their mental health during and following the COVID-19 pandemic.

On March 25, The Irish Government and The Department of Health have changed what "s called the  "case definition " for Covid-19 testing. Patients will have to display two major symptoms rather than one before they are tested: They will have to have a fever and at least one other sign of a respiratory problem.
On 19 Apr Ireland announced that "all residents and staff in long-term residential care units are to be tested for Covid-19 over the next seven to ten days".
From 27 April, testing criteria for the virus was broadened again by The Department of Health to include anyone with one of the symptoms of fever, recent onset of cough or shortness of breath.

Leo Varadkar, the t "naiste (Ireland deputy prime minister), said on July 14 the government was considering introducing the tests as the country, which has largely suppressed community transmission, experiences growing concern that imported cases could trigger a second wave. Varadkar told RT " any testing would be for people coming from countries not on Dublin "s  "green list " of countries (The 15 countries are Malta, Finland, Norway, Italy, Hungary, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Cyprus, Slovakia, Greece, Greenland, Gibraltar, Monaco, and San Marino) deemed to have the pandemic largely under control.
On Mar 24 Ireland adviced its citizens that "no unnecessary travel should take place within the country or overseas, now or over the Easter break" until Apr 19.
Ireland announced that from Mar 28 "there will be a nationwide restriction on travel outside of 2 kilometres from your place of residence" until Apr 12.

According to Phase 2 of Ireland's Roadmap on June 5, the government and the department of health announced that from June 8, people may travel within their own county, or up to 20 kilometres from their home if crossing county boundaries.
Ireland eases travel restrictions from 29th June onwards

On March 27, the Ireland Government announced that from midnight people should stay at home for two weeks until 12 April in a significant tightening of curbs on social and commercial life except if you work in essential services and there is no travel outside of 2 km of your own home for any reason.

On August 7, the Ireland Government announced that from midnight people in Kildare, Laois and Offaly are being asked to restrict their movements to within their own county other than some reasons until August 21 midnight.
On October 19, the Ireland Government has announced that the country will move to Level 5 Covid-19 restrictions for six weeks from midnight October 21 until December 1.

On 16 March, Ireland Government has announced that established a Pandemic Unemployment Payment which would be available for six weeks to help employees and the self-employed who have lost their job on or after 13 March due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

The minister for Finance and Public Expenditure & Reform of the Republic of Ireland put measures in place in coordination with 5 retail banks (AIB, Bank of Ireland, KBC, Permanent tsb and Ulster Bank) and the European Central Bank to support individuals and businesses affected by covid-19 on March 18. These measures are meant to support customers like bank borrowers and costumers with rental property.
Ireland passed an Emergency legislation on Mar 28 "to help businesses to keep their staff in work, increase social welfare payments, freeze rents".
On Mar 28 Ireland announced that "local authorities will relax on-street parking laws to meet the travel needs of essential workers" until Apr 12.
In Ireland from Mar 28 "public transport and passenger travel will be restricted to those who are buying food or medicines, carers, going to medical appointments and essential workers" until Apr 12.

On May 2, The Irish Government agreed, at a special Cabinet meeting, a suite of measures to further support small, medium and larger business that are negatively impacted by Covid-19. It follows the publication the 1st of May evening of the Government "s Roadmap for Reopening Society & Business, which sets out a five stage plan to ease the Covid-19 restrictions and reopen Ireland "s economy and society.

On February 4, the Ireland Government announced that the establishment of an Expert Advisory Group, to function as an expert sub-group, would provide advice to the National Public Health Emergency Team, the HSE and others was noted. The first meeting will take place on February 5.

On February 4, the Ireland Government announced that the establishment of an Expert Advisory Group, to function as an expert sub-group, would provide advice to the National Public Health Emergency Team, the HSE and others was noted. The second meeting will take place on February 11.

On March 24, the Ireland Government announced that the NPHET met and has recommended some new actions to help slow the virus such as to physical distancing, regular handwashing, taking care when sneezing and coughing, and reducing the number of social events and gatherings you attend.
In Ireland on April 2nd the government launched a campaign "The community call" to link local and national government with the community and voluntary sectors.
On April 15 Ireland launched a new campaign to rech out to victims of domestic abuse (during Covid-19).

On 12 August, it was announced that the Government of Ireland intends to move away from the phases of re-opening the country, and switch to a colour-coded system planned by the National Public Health Emergency Team to indicate how counties, regions and the country as a whole are currently affected by COVID-19 and allow people know where they're at on any given day.
On Mar 12 the Irish government urged people to "self-isolate if they have flu-like symptoms regardless of travel or contact history". These regulations should be kept until Mar 29.
In Ireland the Chief Medical Officer advises Parents of "school children travelling from affected regions in the last 14 days and showing symptoms to stay home (quarantine) and contact their GP".
On May 5, the Ireland Government announced that those who are self-quarantining can travel up to 5km from their homes for exercise so long as they avoid all contact with other people.

On July 23, Ireland Government has agreed that the following locations be included as 'normal precautions' on the Department of Foreign Affairs' Travel Advice Anyone arriving into Ireland from these locations will not have to restrict their movements. The 15 green list countries are Malta, Finland, Norway, Italy, Hungary, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Cyprus, Slovakia, Greece, Greenland, Gibraltar, Monaco, and San Marino. Passengers from any other location not on this list are asked to restrict their movements for 14 days.

On August 4, Ireland Government has updated its official 'green list' of countries following the meeting with the National Public Health Emergency Team (NPHET). Cyprus, Malta, Gibraltar, San Marino and Monaco have been removed from the list of countries from which travellers would not have to self-quarantine for 14 days. The countries that remain on the green list are Finland, Norway, Italy, Hungary, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Slovakia, Greece and Greenland.

On September 17, the Ireland Government announced that new 7 green list countries include Cyprus, Finland, Germany, Iceland, Latvia, Lithuania, and Poland. Effective from September 21 passengers from that countries do not have to quarantine for 14 days upon arrival into the nation. Passengers from any other location not on this list are asked to restrict their movements for 14 days.

On September 24, the Ireland Government announced that new 4 green list countries include Cyprus, Finland, Latvia, and Liechtenstein. Effective from September 28 passengers from that countries do not have to quarantine for 14 days upon arrival into the nation. Passengers from any other location not on this list are asked to restrict their movements for 14 days.
On March 12 Ireland announced that "museum, galleries and tourism sites will close" until Mar 29.
On March 15, the Ireland Government has advised public houses, pubs, and bars (including hotel bars) to close from 15 March evening until at least 29 March.

On March 24 the Taoiseach and Department of Health in Ireland published that "all non-essential retail outlets are to close to members of the public and all other retail outlets are to implement physical distancing" until Apr 19th. Also "hairdressers, theatres, clubs, gyms, leisure centres, betting shops, marts, markets, casinos, bingo halls and libraries as well as similar outlets are to be shut", "cafes and restaurants are to limit supply to take away" until Apr 19.
On Mar 24 Ireland decided that all "hotels are limited to non-social and non-tourist occupancy" until Apr 19.
On Mar 28 in Ireland "all adult community education centres and local community centres were closed" until Apr 12.

On June 5, the Ireland Government announced that pubs and bars that serve food and meet other features expected of a restaurant (if they serve "substantial" meals costing not less than  "9) will be allowed to reopen on 29 June.

On July 10, Minister for Health, Stephen Donnelly TD signed the mandatory wearing of face coverings on public transport. The regulations provide that, from 13 July 2020, members of the public who are 13 years old or older shall wear a face covering on public transport unless they have a reasonable excuse not to. The new Regulation applies to all bus and rail services provided under contract with the National Transport Authority (NTA), Luas services and commercial bus services licensed by the NTA.

On July 15, the Ireland Government announced that Phase 4 of Ireland "s Roadmap for reopening society and business was delayed from 20 July to 10 August. Pubs, bars, hotel bars, nightclubs, and casinos will remain closed until 10 August. Pubs currently serving food can remain open.
On June 5, the Ireland Government announced that pubs and bars that don "t serve food can reopen on July 20.
On August 1, Acting Chief Medical Officer, Department of Health, Ronan Glynn announced that restaurants must enforce a limit of 50 people (including staff) on their premises at any one time.

On August 18, the Ireland Government announced that restaurants and cafes (including pubs that serve food and hotel restaurants) can remain open, with a mandatory closing time of 11.30pm. The ministers for health and justice are considering introducing legislation to give additional powers to garda " and other agencies to immediately close down any pub or facility abusing the public health measures.

On October 19, the Ireland Government has announced that the country will move to Level 5 Covid-19 restrictions from midnight October 21 until December 1. Wet pubs, bars, cafes and restaurants (including hotel restaurants and bars) take away food or delivery only. Wet pubs in Dublin remain closed. Nightclubs, discos and casinos will remain closed. People should work from home unless they are providing an essential service. Essential retail and essential services will remain open. This includes food shopping. All other retail and personal services are closed. Hotels, guesthouses and B&Bs may remain open, but only to support provision of essential services.
Ireland's Road Safety Authority suspended all driving tests from Mar 16 until April 19.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

description: Ireland announced that from 25 March the Driver Theory Test Centres will close until further notice.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

description: On March 9, Taoiseach Leo Varadkar said a number of Ireland's St. Patrick's Day parades are being canceled over fears the mass gatherings would contribute to the spread of the coronavirus outbreak from March 13-17.
In Ireland "all playgrounds and holiday or caravan parks are closed" from March 24 to April 19.
In Ireland "outdoor socialising is limited to 4 person, unless all are from the same household, but not a mixed group of people from different households" from Mar 24 until Apr 19.
On Mar 24 Ireland announced that "all organised social indoor and outdoor events of any size are not to take place." until Apr 19.
On March 24 Ireland announced "that all sporting events are cancelled, including those behind closed doors" until Apr 19.
In Ireland on Apr 21 the government announced that "largescale future events which require licensing excessing the number of 5000 will not be considered until the end of August" (mass gatherings).

On May 2 Ireland Government announced Phase 1. From May 18, up to 4 people who don't live together can meet outdoors while keeping at least 2 metres apart. People can exercise - either on their own or in a group of no more than 4 people - where social distancing can be maintained and where there is no contact with other people. It is now possible to participate in a range of sporting activities in groups of no more than 4 people within 5 kilometres of the households of those involved.
On June 5, Ireland Government announced Phase 1. From June 8, up to 25 immediate family and close friends may attend funeral services.

According to Phase 2 of Ireland's Roadmap on June 5, the government and the department of health announced that from the 8th of June, people may meet up to 6 people from outside their household both indoors and outdoors for social gatherings. Organised outdoor exercise, sporting, cultural or social activities of up to 15 people may take place.

According to Phase 3 of Ireland's Roadmap, the government announced on June 19, indoor gatherings of up to 50 people when conducted in line with public health advice are permissible. Outdoor gatherings of up to 200 people when conducted in line with public health advice are permissible.
According to Phase 3 of Ireland's Roadmap, the government announced on June 19, Social visits to people "s homes should be limited to a maximum of 10 visitors  " from no more than 4 other households.

On August 18, Ireland Government announced that all outdoor gatherings are to be limited to 15 people; indoor gatherings will be limited to 6 people until September 13. Businesses, such as shops and restaurants, indoor weddings, some religious services are exempt from the new restrictions, meaning they can still take place with up to 50 people.

On October 19, the Ireland Government has announced that the country will move to Level 5 Covid-19 restrictions from midnight October 21 until December 1. There should be no other visits to homes or gardens. It is possible to meet with 1 other household in an outdoor setting which is not a home or garden, such as a park, including for exercise. No other social or family gatherings should take place. Up to 25 guests can attend a wedding ceremony and reception, whether indoors or outdoors. Up to 25 mourners can attend to the funerals.

On February 17, the Ireland Government announced that people should maintain physical distancing, that is, leave at least 2 metres (6 feet) distance between themselves and other people, particularly those who are coughing, sneezing and have a fever.

In a letter to parents of a closed school in Ireland, Dublin the Department of Health asked parents to make sure that the children who attended the closed school "restrict their movements, avoid crowded places, other large events for 14 days"(social distancing), starting from Mar 01 - Mar 16.

On Mar 12 the Irish government asked all citizens "to reduce social interactions with people outside the workplace and that they are required to avoid crowded places, increase interpersonal distance, and practise protective measures when in crowded settings" until Mar 29.
The Republic of Ireland announced on Mar 12th that "cultural institutions will close" after 6pm the same day until Mar 29th to enforce social distancing.

The Republic of Ireland issued on Mar 12th that "where possible you should work from home. In order to reduce unnnecessary face to face interaction in the workplace, break times and working times should be staggered and meetings done remotely or by phone." The measure will last until Mar 29th to keep up social distancing.

On Mar 12 the government of the Republic of Ireland decided that "visiting of hospitals and nursing homes as well as residential services will be restricted and is asking for limited contact within in long stay settings" until Mar 29 to maintain social distancing.

On Mar 12th TD Leo Varadkar of Ireland and the Department of Health said that people in Ireland should seek "social distancing is keeping a 2 metre (6 feet) space between you and other people. You should not shake hands or make close contact where possible."

On 15th March 2020 the Republic of Ireland decided that "all pubs are asked to close from tonight and the government strongly advises against any 'House Parties' " to expand guidelines of social distancing.

Ireland announced new measures applicable for public transport for social distancing purposes on mar 24: "Cleaning schedules on public transport are to be improved, people should not use public transport unless its absolutely necesarry, transport companies are to apply social distancing measures and limit the numbers permitted on public transport at any one time" until Apr 19.

On Mar 24 the Irish government announced that "social distancing, in as far as practicable, is to be ensured between clients/patients in confined settings, such as long-term care facilities, either for elderly persons or persons with special needs, psychiatric institutions, homeless shelters, prisons." until Apr 19.

On Mar 24 the Irish government said that "all essential retail outlets are to implement social distancing and all cafes and restaurants should implement social distancing measures in respect of queuing for take away food" until Apr 19.
In Ireland "the places of worship are to restrict numbers entering at any one time to ensure adequate physical distancing" from Mar 24 until Apr 19.
From Mar 24 on in Ireland "members of vulnerable groups should stay in their own home as much as possible" until Apr 19.
In Ireland from Mar 24 "all household contacts of a suspected case should restrict movements until the test is reported negative or for 14 days, whichever is shorter" (until Apr 19).

On March 12th the Republic of Ireland issued that "restaurants, cafes and other businesses can stay open but should always look at ways that they can implement the public health advice on social distancing." It'll last until March 29th.

On May 2, according to the Ireland Government Phase 1, shops that are mainly outdoor (for example: garden centres, hardware stores, farmers' markets) can reopen so long as social distancing measures can be put in place. Also, a phased return of outdoor workers (for example: construction workers, gardeners, including people working on allotments) has commenced. Outdoor spaces and tourism sites (for example: car parks, beaches, mountain walks) are open where people can move around freely and social distancing requirements continue to apply. Face coverings are now required on public transport. Face coverings will also be required in shops and shopping centres. Regulations with details on enforcement are in the process of being drafted

In support of the public health recommendations on wearing face coverings issued by the Ireland Government on May 14, masks were distributed to garda " on May 18, Garda " have been instructed to wear face masks in situations where they cannot maintain social distancing and where they may be in close contact with someone for more than 15 minutes for example on public transport, in enclosed spaces including patrol cars/checkpoints/open areas.

According to Phase 2 of Ireland's Roadmap on June 5, the government and the department of health annonouced that people should walk or cycle if they can. Only use public transport if  absolutely needed to. Public transport capacity is limited because of social distancing requirements.

From 16 July, Ireland Government announced that face coverings should be worn by all customers in shops and shopping centres across the country. Retail staff will also be required to wear a face covering unless there is a partition between them and members of the public or where there is a distance of 2 metres between them and members of the public. Regulations, with details on enforcement and penalties are in the process of being drafted. Face coverings and social distancing are also required on public transport.
On 4 August, Ireland Government has announced that face coverings will be mandatory in shops, supermarkets and shopping centres from Monday 10 August.
On August 18, Ireland Government announced that all customer facing staff to wear face coverings and all customers to wear face coverings until seated and again on departure.

On August 21, the Ireland Government has decided to continue the enhanced public health measures for Kildare until September 6. People should not use public transport unless it is absolutely necessary to do so, and where possible should not share private vehicles with others from outside their household.

Israel's "Strategic Affairs Ministry has in recent days been pushing an initiative to draft youth in Israel and around the world into a campaign against the surge in antisemitism witnessed online due to the coronavirus pandemic."

On August 3, Israel's ministry of health released a humorous video as a public information campaign to reduce the spread of Coronavirus. The ad remained on the YouTube page of Lapam, the government ad agency, until August 5, when the Chinese Embassy in Israel complained about it and it was taken down.
Israel closed schools, with the exception of preschools, special education centers, and youth-at-risk centers, from March 12 through May 3 in response to the COVID pandemic.

Israel introduced a phased reopening of schools, with social distancing measures and a limited number of students, beginning May 3, and schools were fully reopened by May 17. Schools began shutting down again on June 3 due to outbreaks of Coronavirus.
On June 3, the Israeli Ministry of Education ordered any school that suffered a Coronavirus outbreak since reopening to close.

Israel announced on August 10 that schools will open on September 1 for children in all grade levels, subject to restrictions. Those restrictions are:
- Preschool children will go to school 6 days a week with no restrictions
- Grades 1 and 2 will go to school 5 days a week with normal classroom sizes and will not be required to wear masks
- Grades 3 and 4 will go to school 5 days a week in classes no larger than 18 students, and will sit at individual tables. Grade 3 will be required to wear masks only at recess, and Grade 4 and above will wear masks all the time.
- Grades 5 and 6 will be at school 2 days a week, in classes no larger than 18 students, and will learn remotely at home the other 3 days.
- All students will be required to bring in a daily health form.

The ministry of Health of Israel ordered that "from Wednesday, April 08, 2020 at 15:00, until Thursday, April 09, 2020, at 07:00, leaving the house is forbidden even for the purpose of procuring food."

On April 30, 2020, regulations for the Independence Day in Israel are announced: Beginning Tuesday, April 28, 2020 at 17:00 until Wednesday, April 29, 2020 at 20:00 there will be a curfew for all people with some exceptions.

"Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced late Monday [March 16, 2020] an emergency framework as a preventive measure against the new coronavirus.   

Netanyahu said in a televised statement that the public sector will carry out its duty in line with the state of emergency, according to local media.

The decision will take effect Wednesday," March 18, 2020.
"Israel is in a state of emergency due to a resurgent coronavirus outbreak, and additional steps are needed to try to stem the spread, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday," July 5, 2020.
Israel on February 17 announced it was refusing entry to all foreign nationals who had traveled to Thailand, Singapore, Hong Kong and Macau during the past 14 days.
Starting February 24th, Israel will also ban all foreign nationals who have been to South Korea and Japan in the past 14 days from entering the country.

In Israel, on February 26, 2020 the Ministry of Health declares: "The public is advised to avoid travel to international conferences, conventions or any other congregate settings, including travel to religious events, where foreign nationals assemble. Avoid organizing international conferences in Israel. Elaborate guidance will be released in the Ministry of Health Website."
In Israel on March 4, 2020: "Healthcare system employees are not permitted to travel abroad."
To prevent the spread of the novel coronavirus, no soldier will be allowed to leave Israel starting at noon on march 6, the IDF announced Thursday March 5.
The Israeli Ministry of Health, on March 11, 2020: "We urge all citizens and residents of Israel and those staying in Israel (tourists) to avoid entering the Palestinian Authority territories."

On March 18, the Government of Israel announced that foreigners, including U.S. citizens, who are not Israeli citizens or permanent residents will not be allowed to enter Israel. Exceptions may be made for non-nationals whose lives are based in Israel.

Israel permitted approximately 30,000 Palestinian workers, predominantly in the construction industry, to stay in Israel during the Coronavirus crisis. The decision was designed to enable the construction industry to continue while the border between Israel and the West Bank closed due to Coronavirus. The policy was implemented on March 18, 2020.
On June 18, 2020, Israel announced that it would open its borders to tourism from Greece beginning August 1. Visitors would not be required to quarantine for 14 days.

As of August 3, 2020, "2,000 university students and 12,000 yeshiva students will be permitted to enter Israel for their respective programs. Another 5,000 participants in Masa programs, 500 high school exchange students on the Naale program and 1,500 people at private institutions will also be allowed into the country."

Israel plans to "open the skies" to international travelers on August 16. On August 6, the Transportation Minister, Health Minister, and Foreign Minister released a plan to allow for arrivals from green states (countries with low Coronavirus infection rates) to enter Israel without quarantine. Arrivals from red countries will need to quarantine, but the number of days might be shortened from 14.

Israel is allowing more outbound international travel. Starting 16.8.2020, Israelis may fly to 3 countries  " Bulgaria, Croatia, and Greece.

Greece: Greece will admit 600 Israelis in total, to be distributed between Thessaloniki, Athens, Corfu, and Crete. Passengers to Greece will be required to undergo coronavirus tests in Israel, and upon arrival in Greece, they will be necessary to stay in the hotel until their test results arrive, up to 48 hours at most.

Bulgaria: Israelis arriving in Bulgaria will be required to undergo coronavirus tests in Israel 72 hours ahead of their flight. Upon arrival in Bulgaria, they will not be required to undergo coronavirus tests or to quarantine.

Croatia: Israelis wishing to enter Croatia will be required to undergo coronavirus tests in Israel 48 hours ahead of their flight. Upon arrival in Croatia, they will not be required to undergo coronavirus tests or to quarantine. They should arrive at the airport with a certificate stating that they tested negative for coronavirus.

Israel has added the UAE, Thailand, Ireland, Taiwan, Portugal, Norway, Australia, SIngapore, and Uruguay to their list of "green countries," meaning that Israeli citizens may travel home from those countries without being required to isolate.
The list of green countries already included Italy, the UK, Georgia, Germany, Hong Kong, Jordan, Latvia, Lithuania, New Zealand, Estonia, Canada, Rwanda, Denmark, Slovenia, and Austria, as well as Greece, Bulgaria, and Croatia, where Israelis may travel without quarantining or isolating at all.
In Israel, on February 3, 2020, "the Ministry of Health shall issue a valid sickness certificate to anyone who is legally required to remain quarantined for the duration of the quarantine period."

On February 17, 2020, it is announced that "the State of Israel is preparing to bring back its citizens who were on board the Diamond Princess ship in Japan under protective quarantine conditions. The Minister of Health, Ya "akov Litzman, and the Director General of the Ministry of Health, Mr. Moshe Bar Siman Tov, instructed the Shiba Medical Center to prepare to receive the Israelis upon their arrival in Israel. The Shiba Medical Center is preparing to receive the Israelis in a separate unit manned by a designated team specifically assigned to this task. During their stay at the designated unit, the Shiba Medical Center will continue its regular activity with complete separation  " both physical and infrastructural  " from the quarantine area."

In Israel, on March 9, 2020: "Regarding tourists currently in Israel, they will be given time to leave Israel in an orderly fashion. Until the date of their departure, they will be obliged to adhere to 5 rules: Upon the onset of symptoms  " Call Magen David Adom immediately (101), maintain strict hygiene, avoid gatherings, it will not be possible to return to Israel after departing to neighboring countries, keep a diary of your activities and movements while in Israel."

"Israel "s government has approved emergency measures to track people suspected or confirmed to have been infected with the coronavirus by monitoring their mobile phones, immediately raising privacy concerns in the country." The policy was implemented on March 17, 2020, and lasted for 30 days until April 16.

In Israel, on March 22, 2020, the Ministry of Health launches "app that allows the identification of contacts between diagnosed patients and people who came in contact with them in the 14 days prior to the patient's diagnosis of the Coronavirus".

In Israel, on March 25, 2020, it was announced: "The employer is obligated to measure body temperature at the entrance to the workplace. A person with a temperature exceeding 38 "C will not be permitted entrance."

On April 5, 2020, in Israel the Ministry of Health announced the launch of "a professional and task-specific telephone support line for medical teams, healthcare system employees and retired employees, and members of their families, who are faced with the Coronavirus."
"On Wednesday night [June 24, 2020], Israel "s parliament, the Knesset, voted to approve a bill authorising Shin Bet to track coronavirus cases and those in contact with them."

On February 11, 2020, it is announced in Israel: "The Ministry's working assumption is that the coronavirus will reach Israel, and the healthcare system continues to prepare for this scenario. The Ministry of Health has increased the capacity of screening tests at the central laboratory in Tel Hashomer, and in the next few days, will prepare 3 additional laboratories to run coronavirus screening tests and verify its possible presence at Soroka, Hadassah and Rambam medicl centers."
In Israel, on February 18, 2020, it is declared that "the Ministry of Health took action to allocate a ward in every general hospital as a designated ward for possible coronavirus patients."

Israel's Minister of Science and Technology Ofir Akunis "instructed the Director-General of the Ministry of Science and Technology to fast-track all approval processes with the goal of bringing the human vaccine to market as quickly as possible" for a potential vaccine discovery by researchers at MIGAL Institute on February 27, 2020.

"Israel announced that it would set aside special funds for medical equipment as its large army prepares to deal with the coronavirus outbreak that is rippling across the Middle East. The country plans to spend $14 million on medical equipment for the Israel Defense Forces (IDF), the Ministry of Defense said on March 11."
On March 20, 2020, in Israel: "The Ministry of Health Approved Local Production of Applicators".
In Israel, on April 1, 2020, it is announced that "the Ministry of Health certified 900 registered nurses by means of quick procedure."
On April 4, 2020, in Israel: "Therefore, we are instructing everyone to wear a mask at all times in public."

In Israel, on April 8, 2020, the Ministry of Health announced the purchase of new equipment and supplies for laboratories, the initiation of trainings for the laboratory staff as well as the decision to purchase additional machines in HMO laboratories to allow for at least 10,000 additional tests.

In Israel, "the health and defense ministries have launched a project to manufacture reusable masks made of high-density cotton, a report said Friday [April 17, 2020]. The face masks are designed to fit everyone, including children and bearded men." In Israel, Orthodox Jews, religious Muslims, and Christian clergy tend to grow long beards, which made it difficult for them to wear the standard masks. Israel had already produced 1,000,000 cotton masks by April 19, but not all from this particular initiative.

On April 19, 2020, the Israel Innovation Authority announced that it "is spearheading the formation of a new tech innovation lab to promote investments in the field of digital health with an emphasis on pharmatech and artificial intelligence. The government "s tech investment arm issued a call for proposals on Sunday, inviting companies to submit a proposal and join a competitive process to establish and operate the lab that aims to help Israel in the diagnosis and treatment of the coronavirus (Covid-19) pandemic and is funded to the tune of NIS 32 million (approximately $9 million)."

"Israel will approve an 800 million shekel (about $230 million) payment to the Palestinian Authority Sunday evening to help it cope with the coronavirus, Finance Ministry officials confirmed Sunday," May 10, 2020. The payments will come in four monthly installments, so they will end on September 10, 2020.

Reported 20 May, Nauru Bulletin. Honorary Consul for Israel Sean Oppenheimer presented on behalf of Israel a COVID-19 PPE package including face masks, body suits, infra-red thermometers, gloves and goggles.President  Aingimea  expressed  his  appreciation  and  thanks  for  the support of these generous donors.

On June 16, the Embassy of Israel provided 550 units of Personal Protective Equipment (PPEs), 10,000 units of masks, 50 units of infrared digital thermometers and 5,000 pairs of surgical gloves, along with hand sanitizers, hand sprayers and disinfectant solutions to Nepal.

"Israel has signed with Moderna Inc for the future purchase of its potential COVID-19 vaccine should the company succeed in its development, Israel's Channel 13 news reported on Tuesday," June 16, 2020.

"Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel announced a new partnership with the United Arab Emirates on Thursday to cooperate in the fight against the coronavirus, portraying it as the latest advance in the Jewish state "s efforts to build stronger ties with Arab states."

"'The partnership would include cooperation in research and development between the Israeli and Emirati health ministries in medical projects related to the coronavirus,' he said."

On August 13 Israel opened  a new hospitalization center for coronavirus patients at Herzog Medical Center with a capacity of 160 beds, of which 36 have been inaugurated today.   

The center was built with the support of the Ministry of Health.

On August 15, Israeli and UAE firms signed a deal to work together on coronavirus research and development. The Emirati APEX National Investment company has signed a "strategic commercial agreement" with Israel's Tera Group to cooperate on research and development related to COVID-19, including a testing device,

On January 26, 2020, in Israel: "The The Ministry stresses that whoever arrived from China and does not exhibit any symptoms of the disease does not need to get tested. In case that a respiratory disease (fever and coughing) appears during travel to China or within 14 days after the last stay in China: 
Refer to your treating physician at the HMO or go to the emergency room as soon as possible. Call in advance and notify emergency room staff that the patient suffers from respiratory disease and that the patient stayed in China, before arriving at the hospital or the offices of your treating physician at the HMO. Avoid traveling in public transportation. Until tested by a physician, keep your mouth and nose covered by a surgical mask or by another available cloth. Upon entering the clinic or the emergency room, promptly report the symptoms of the disease to the receptionist or the nurse on duty, and disclose the possible connection to a stay in China about 14 days before the appearance of the symptoms."

On February 7, 2020, in Israel "the Ministry of Health expands its definition of suspected exposure to Coronavirus for purposes of performing medical tests on people returning from additional countries and regions. Any person who [...] stayed in one of the following countries or regions: China, Hong Kong, Thailand, Japan, Singapore, South Korea or Macau in the 14 days preceding the appearance of symptoms described below [...] should approach the nearest clinic or hospital."

In Israel, on February 7, 2020 "the Ministry of Health expands its definition of suspected exposure to Coronavirus for purposes of performing medical tests on people returning from additional countries and regions. The new definition is as follows:
Any person [that] came in direct contact with a verified patient and exhibiting one or more of the following symptoms - fever over 38 degrees, coughing, difficulty breathing or any other respiratory symptom - should approach the nearest clinic or hospital."
Israel increased testing in Arab cities to gain information on the spread of Coronavirus in the Arab community, beginning March 30, 2020.
On April 7, 2020, in Israel: "The Director General has decided to have more [Covid-19] tests done in nursing homes."
Israel is conducting "random nationwide coronavirus antibody testing," beginning June 29, 2020. The program expects to test 7,500 people and will last for "several days."

Israel's Ministry of Health reduced testing terms in order to ease the burden on HMOs (Health Maintenance Organizations) on July 15, 2020. The ministry introduced a quota on tests and requires patients to fit into the following categories to receive a test: member of a household containing an infected person, workers in high-risk institutions like senior homes and nursing homes, and patients receiving non-urgent procedures. Asylum seekers and foreign workers may also arrange to be tested.

Israel sent a delegation to India to collect 20,000 Coronavirus testing samples in order to aid with the development of more efficient testing procedures from July 27-August 4. The delegation also delivered medical equipment to India.

On July 28, 2020, Israel's Coronavirus Czar Ronni Gamzu announced that part of his "Shield of Israel" plan will be to increase testing to 60,000 tests per day within the next two months and up to 100,000 by the winter.

On August 6, 2020, Israel announced that "a coronavirus drive-through testing lab will be opened at Ben Gurion Airport. Passengers will be required to come by the airport 72 hours prior to their flight to be tested," in order to travel internationally.
Israel's health and religious services ministries will allow mikvehs, or ritual baths, to operate despite hygienic concerns, as of April 23, 2020.

On April 2, the Israeli government approved new regulations to allow closure on areas identified as coronavirus hot spots, prompting authorities to designate the central ultra-Orthodox city of Bnei Brak a  "restricted zone. " Movements to and from the city will only be allowed for essential needs or in extraordinary circumstances.

On April 7, 2020 the Government of the State of Israel approved emergency regulations in Israel during the Passover holiday: "Starting today, April 07, 2020, at 19:00, until Friday, April 10, 2020, at 06:00, people are prohibited from leaving their village, town, or city of residence."

On April 7, 2020, the Ministry of Health in Israel is determining "that from April 07, 2020, at 20:00 until Sunday, April 12, 2020 at 08:00, public transportation services will be discontinued, including international passenger flights".

On April 12, 2020, in Israel, it was announced that some precincts in the city of Jerusalem are now designated as restricted areas. As of Sunday April 12, 2020 at 12:00, it will not be possible to go outside of "restricted areas".

In Israel, it was announced on April 14, 2020: "Public transportation activities will be discontinued during the period between Monday (April 13, 2020) at 20:00 and Thursday (April 16, 2020) at 05:00."

In Israel, on April 14, 2020, it was announced that "people may not leave their municipality to purchase food, medicines, or essential products nor to receive essential services [...]. Also, permission to go out in public is permissible only for a short time and up to 100 meters from one "s residence" during the period from Tuesday (April 14, 2020) at 17:00 to Thursday (April 16, 2020) at 05:00.

On April 22, the Government of the State of Israel approved via teleconference emergency regulations restricting outings in the public space during Memorial Day: "We emphasize that the regulations on Memorial Day Eve and Memorial Day (beginning on Monday, 27, 2020 at 16:00) will not allow visits to cemeteries and memorial sites."

On March 17, Israel issued "mandatory lockdown" guidelines that stated, "Do not go outside, unless absolutely necessary (for work and in accordance with the restrictions below and in accordance with separately released directions, or to buy food or medicines, for medical care and other vital activities).
Do not got to parks, playgrounds, the beach, pools, nature reserves or other public places, however children can go outside with the family or with a pet (alone)."
On April 1 this lockdown policy was ended and a new lockdown policy with an expanded list of exemptions was implemented.
Israel is enforcing a 7 day lockdown starting Friday March 20. Israelis are only allowed to leave their homes if absolutely necessary.

Israel is enforcing new lockdown guidelines on April 1; Going out in public is not allowed, except for one of the following purposes:
Going to and returning from the work place, as permitted by regulations
Purchase of food, medicines, essential products and receiving vital services
Receiving medical service
Blood donation
Receiving welfare services
Providing medical or other assistance to another person
An individual, or people who live in the same household, may go out for a short time and up to a distance of 100 meters
For purposes of immersion in a women "s mikveh with a prearranged appointment.
Transfer of a minor to educational facilities, solely for children of essential employees and special facilities (in accordance with Public Health Ordinance order)
Transfer of a minor, whose parents live separately, by one of his parents to the home of the other parent
Transfer of a minor whose guardian must leave for an essential need where there is no responsible person to watch the child
Legal processes
Demonstrations
Going to the Knesset
In Israel on April 15 instructed the residents of four Arab villages in the North to remain in their residences, reporting high rates of coronavirus contraction.
In Israel, several Bedouin towns in the Negev and some neighborhoods in southern Tel Aviv are being labeled "red zones" and put under immediate lockdown, beginning June 11.

In Israel, "The city of Elad and a number of neighborhoods in Tiberias have been designated as restricted zones by the Ministerial Committee on Declaring Restricted Zones, which is headed by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. The affected Tiberias neighborhoods are Ramat Tiberias Bet, Ramat Tiberias Gimmel, the 200 neighborhood, Tiberias Illit and Ben-Gurion. The declaration will be valid for seven days, from 8:00 a.m. on Wednesday, June 24, until 8:00 a.m. on Wednesday, July 1."

Israel's "Ministerial Committee on Restricted Areas has decided to declare the following areas as restricted:

Ashdod  " Neighborhood Gimmel, Zayin, and Het

Lod  " Neighborhood  "HaRakevet ",  "Shnir ", and  "Neve Shalom "

The declaration of these neighborhoods as  "restricted areas " will be for 7 days starting on Thursday, July 2nd, 2020, at 08:00, until Thursday, July 9th, 2020 at 08:00.

In the restricted areas, entry and exit will be limited. Traffic and businesses within the area will also be restricted."

In Israel, the "city of Beitar Illit was declared a restricted zone on Tuesday as coronavirus infections spiked in the city.

The lockdown on the city "s municipal area will last seven days, starting at 1 p.m. Wednesday," from July 8, 2020-July 15, 2020. Beitar Illit is an ultra-Orthodox settlement community inside the West Bank.

In Israel, "parts of Jerusalem, Beit Shemesh, Lod, Ramle and Kiryat Malachi were declared  "restricted zones " for seven days, starting at 1 p.m. on Friday [July 10, 2020], the Prime Minister "s Office and Health Ministry said in a joint statement. The restrictions would be lifted at 8 a.m. on July 17."

On September 3, the Israeli Coronavirus Cabinet voted to impose a lockdown on 30 "red" cities, or cities that have high numbers of Coronavirus cases. The lockdown will take effect on September 7. "The restrictions under discussion for the 30 municipalities included banning entry and exit, keeping residents within 500 meters of their homes, stopping public transportation, and closing non-essential businesses and all schools save for daycare facilities and special education programs."
In Israel, on January 27, 2020, "the Minister of Health, Yaakov Litzman, signed the People's Health Ordinance Decree to expand the Ministry's powers to deal with the Coronavirus."
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: On March 13, 2020: "A specially formed force, composed of Israeli police and health inspectors, continues to carry out visits to ensure the isolation. The Israeli police will continue increased visible and covert activity with the aim of assisting the Ministry of Health in the enforcement effort. The Israeli police will act in accordance with the policies and guidelines against the violators to prevent the spread of the coronavirus in Israel."
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: In Israel on March 19, 2020 a cooperation between the Ministry of Health and Defense Agencies, especially with the Mossad, during Coronavirus Event was announced.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: In Israel on March 19, 2020 information was published about a "joint operation of Israel Police and [the] Ministry of Health Inspection Team".
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: On March 24, 2020, Israel's Knesset created a special committee to deal with the Coronavirus. "The committee would oversee all matters related to the spread and treatment of the virus."
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: In Israel, on March 24, 2020: "The Prime Minister instructed the Mossad and the Defense Ministry to establish a command center [...] to integrate additional elements from the Health, Finance and Justice ministries, along with others, in the procurement efforts."
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: The Israeli government has opened up the National Management Center in the Jerusalem hills to help coordinate its campaign against the spread of the coronavirus on March 26.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: On April 7, 2020, the Israeli Government granted the police expanded authority for enforcement of the declared emergency regulations during the Passover holiday.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: Israel's Knesset (Parliament) passed a law on July 6, 2020, that "stipulates that fines can be given out by municipal inspectors, Israel Nature and Parks Authority inspectors and local authority workers." The law refers to the 500 shekel ($145) fine for not wearing a mask in public.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: "The Israeli government passed a bill Tuesday [July 7, 2020] early morning allowing for decisions made to combat the coronavirus to go into immediate effect  " even before they are debated and voted upon in the Knesset."
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: Israel's Coronavirus Cabinet announced on July 16, 2020, that Prime Minister Benjamin "Netanyahu and Alternate Prime Minister Benny Gantz were put in charge of restrictions concerning the education system," that "ministries will be closed to the public. All civilian contact with ministries will be online," and "ministries will be limited to a 50% worker capacity."
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: The Israeli government created a new position called the Coronavirus Czar to oversee Coronavirus response efforts and "handle interactions with the Defense Ministry, the IDF and oversee testing and epidemiological tracking." The position was first offered to Gabriel Barbash, who declined it after his conditions were not met by the government. As a result, Ronni Gamzu will serve in the role.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: Israel's Coronavirus Czar Ronni Gamzu announced the new "Shield of Israel" strategic plan for combatting Coronavirus. "The Shield of Israel plan has three main arms: 1) a new contract will be established between the public and those managing the coronavirus crisis; 2) the IDF will take over the management of testing and contact tracing; 3) data will be consolidated and presented in a unified manner."
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: On August 9, Israel's Coronavirus Cabinet announced that district doctors in the health ministry would have the authority to close businesses where Coronavirus was discovered.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: Israel's coronavirus czar Prof. Gamzu announced plans for  a  "traffic light " system for gauging coronavirus levels in different parts of Israel on July 28. His  "traffic light " program creates a system for labeling coronavirus levels in different parts of the country, color-coding municipalities like traffic lights: green, yellow, orange and red. His idea is to let the municipalities take a more active role in managing their constituents and partnering with the Health Ministry and the IDF to stop the spread of infection. This program was also approved and is expected to go into effect on September 1. Starting September 1, restrictions on communities will be determined by what color "zone" they fall in, either green, yellow, orange, or red.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: In Israel, on March 4, 2020: "The Ministry of Health recommends to practice strict hygiene and avoid shaking hands."
On March 12, 2020, The Israeli Population and Immigration Authority (PIBA) automatically extended visas of numerous categories (Work Visa, Temporary Resident Visa etc.).

On March 16, 2020, the Israeli Ministry of Finance publishes measures to maintain the stability of the economy, "including deferred payments for and small and medium-sized businesses and self-employed, a special grant for self-employed, a special grant for people made redundant, easier conditions for receiving loans and increased credit, and more."

On July 29, 2020, Israel's Ashkenazi Chief Rabbi (a government position) David Lau ruled that Jews with Coronavirus, including those without symptoms, should not fast for the Tisha b'Av holiday (July 30). He also insisted that people wash their hands and use hand sanitizer, which is normally prohibited on the holiday.
On February 10, 2020, in Israel, the Ministry of Health "stresses that it has created an official, task-specific website on the issue of the Coronavirus."

In Israel, on March 4, 2020: "The Ministry of Health, in cooperation with Belong Life Company, launched today an application that provides information and support regarding the Coronavirus called 'CoronApp.'"

Israel's "Health Ministry announced Sunday [March 22, 2020] the launch of a new smartphone app to help to prevent the spread of the deadly coronavirus  " by enabling users to know if they crossed paths with someone who has been diagnosed with the virus."
"Called Hamagen (The Shield), the app reveals if a user was, over the previous 14 days, in close proximity to anyone who has been diagnosed  with the virus, the ministry said in a statement."

In Israel, on March 23, 2020 the president and heads of authorities joined a solidarity campaign with the Ministry of Health "s guidelines. Several companies and artists were included in the campaign: "If we get out of home - we are not going to get out of it ".
On April 7, 2020, in Israel, a new campaign of the Ministry of Health with cooperation of the Government Press Office targeting the requirement of wearing a mask was launched.

On April 7, 2020 in Israel, a campaign of the Ministry of Health with cooperation of the Government Press Office was launched in order to reiterate the importance of wearing a mask in public and each time leaving the home.

In Israel, on April 7, 2020: "The Ministry of Health is running a blitz campaign 24 hours before Seder night to increase the awareness of the dangers of the coronavirus" in the Jewish Haredi Community including the distribution of pamphlets and children magazines.

On April 7, 2020, the Ministry of Health of Israel announced an intensive campaign in the Jewish Haredi Sector including the distribution of pamphlets and children magazines 24 hours before the beginning of the Jewish Passover Holiday night in oder to increase the awareness of the dangers of the coronavirus.

In Israel, on April 12, 2020, it was announced that "the Ministry of Health's Coronavirus Q&A campaign, in cooperation with the Government Advertising Agency, will be launched today through several media" answering several questions out of public inquiries addressed to the Ministry of Health.

On April 2020, the Israeli Ministry of Health declared the launch of an extensive information campaign ahead of the month Ramadan in order to prevent the spread of the Coronavirus in the Arab sector in Israel.
